Was very impressed with this aquarium and the variety of fish to be seen. The sharks in particular were very impressive. Well worth a visit with young children and easily accessible with a buggy

We came across this place whilst out for a drive. We thought we would take a look. We found the complex a lot better than expected. The large tanks were impressive as was the use of projected holograms. The shop was a rip-off as is usual in these attractions. An enjoyable
Ideal place to take a break from beach, worth to visit, VR was good for 5€ per person. It took about an hour for us

Nice aquarium which has parking just a 1 minute walk away. Great for anyone who likes fish, has children to entertain and / or looking for some time out of the sun. There is a small coffee shop outside as well as the cafe inside, however we did not eat in either on our visit.
Nice family day out. It was different . Really enjoyed ourselves. Would definitely recommend everyone

Ideal place for kids and if you want to take a break from beaches and history of Crete. Not so big. Shark would be main attraction and the jelly fish tank. There is also a VR room with extra payment which we didn't try. A store is there at the end of the tour and also a

Nice sized aquarium with plenty of sea creatures to see and loads of information next to the tanks to read. All the tanks and the fish seemed clean and well looked after. Highlights are the turtles and sharks. There's free parking a short walk away, or get a taxi from
It is worth it to visit with your child. Logical prices for such exhibition. One of the best sightseeing in Europe!
Lovely good sized aquarium with lots to see and loads of information. All the fish seemed well looked after. Plenty of parking. The VR is worth the extra fee. Not overly expensive entrance either

We visited the place on the last Friday of August. We arrived at 10:10 and avoided any queues. Children like the aquariums, fish and especially the one with turtle. Unfortunately as it was quiet, despite not rushing and taking pictures all experience took us only 38 minutes. We
The best aquarium I have ever been to by far, it's quite a large aquarium and the sea life here is incredible such a beautiful place to visit
This Aquarium was great! My Kids had a lot of fun and WOW situations. Specially when they saw the Big Shard Swimming! I would definately recommend it.

A great place for families, with beautiful sea world display. But keep in mind it's rather small- you can spend there about an hour to an hour and a half. There are few more activities for extra charge we didn't try.

Living in Greece, it is important to know what swims just next to you! Such a good effort, both adults and children will enjoy (sharks are impressive). Tip: the souvenir shop is a little pricey but products seems special, also nice the fish fast food/tavern

My son really wanted to go, I wasn’t so keen, but I have to admit I was really surprised by how good it is and wS very glad we went. Clean, well laid out, huge tanks, massive diversity of species, really is worth a visit.

We came here to kill some time on our last day spent a couple of hours here. Was nice & cool plenty to see. Sharks & jellyfish were a favourite with us. We did the vr experience which was a lot of fun well worth the few euros it cost. Only problem we found was that there was too

Entrance price is cheap and the aquarium itself looks decent. Don't get me wrong there are bigger aquariums in the world but all in all this one is a good little time killer. They have a new VR facility that I would highly recommend paying the extra €3 for. Incredibly vivid and

For the money this isn’t a bad half day trip with the kids, and they have a couple of sharks of reasonable size that make it worth a visit (if you like sharks I guess). But what ruined it for us was the sheer number of people, it made it hard at times to see what was in a

Visited here on an afternoon in August with 15 and 11 year old boys. We spent a pleasant couple of hours looking at the various fish and enjoyed a cool drink in the cafe. Overall an enjoyable time, we did pay extra for the vertual reality, which was well worth it!

I really enjoyed the Cretaquarium. Many tanks with many different species including 2 types of shark. Name boards for the different species in several languages which is very handy especially if you do not get the audioguide. It was smaller than what I had pictured and from how
Nice place...small but nice.. I think they should to put more fishes...to make something more interesting

The aquarium was well set out and had lots of interesting fish, including rather large sharks! The jelly fish were so beautiful and peaceful to watch. It was very clean and the fish looked well cared for.
The aquarium is ok but not up to the level of better ones in, for example, Barcelona or Tenerife. It's an ok day out but not for the connaisseur. Couple nice sharks and some interesting local fish.

Well, we really enjoyed it. It’s a sweet, little acquarium and nothing like the grand aquaria of France and Spain. But the background music and gentle fish swimming made it all quite pleasant. There’s a touch of the idiosyncratic, with a video up high of seahorses which are
The only good point : the money you’ll spend here will (partially)help wounded turtles. Lack of things to read, explanations, etc...

beautiful aquarium, next to the beach, many kinds of fish and underwater creatures. there is virtual reality part (which we didn't take) the price is moderate, we spent 30$ for 3 people (2 adults, 1 child. infants are free) we spent almost 2 hours. at the end there is restaurant
In my opinion you need to go There. Its A fun for adults and kids. 10 eur for adult 6 for kid > than 5.
Had a fantastic morning at the aquarium the exhibits are well set out and easy to view lots of information was great to get out of the sun for a few hours and a great time for all of us

Queuing chaos to buy a ticket. Strongly recommend tickets are purchased online allowing you to jump the queue. It was extremely busy and very loud. Repetitive tanks displaying mainly local, endemic fish. Tanks are relatively well maintained, some showing signs of cyano algae

Although we spent a long time queuing to get in, the wait was well worth it. We paid for the full experience (entrance, audio and Virtual Reality). I would say one audio would be enough for one per group, but all the information is readily available to read on boards around the
I love visiting this place. ideal for kids and especially boys that adore sharks! clown fish is my favourite!
Great little aquarium. Our 4-year old enjoyed a couple of hours exploring and checking out the fish, sharks, and turtles. The food at the cafe is also quite good.

Came here July 19 with wife and 3 year old. The aquarium is on the edge of an old abandoned air base so the roads are fairly straight and it’s easy to find. That said, the location is pretty empty so you’d probably go here by taxi / bus which will take you to the entrance.

If you are looking for a break from the heat for a couple of hours then this is worth visiting. Not a massive range of fish, but enough to keep the youngsters happy - especially the Nemos, sharks and turtle.
A wonderful place, worth visiting, we appreciated description and names of animals both in English and Czech, very helpful.

We walked here along the beach from Gouves, what a great place, not too busy but lots to look at. Love the sharks and turtles. Lots of information in lots of languages. We had lunch in the aquarium cafe/kiosk near the entrance which was reasonably priced. Recommend a visit if

Lovely little aquarium, caters well for all languages. Amazing sharks to see and turtles. My son enjoyed it. It wasn’t overpriced and a nice stroll from our hotel in Gouves. Lots to see and read about.

I really liked it. It's not very big, but nice experience and it took us about an hour to walk through. There were fish I loved seeing but most of all I was impressed to see the sand tiger sharks in the big tank at the beginning. Definitely recommend.
A lovely few hours looking around the aquarium. My son loves aquariums so was a sure visit for us. Not the biggest but was nice to do to get out of the sun for a few hours. Kids loved it

Entry fee 10 euro, you can book through TripAdvisor, same price & we suggest you do if you can as we had to queue for a while for our tickets . Whilst small compared to Australian standards, there are plenty of small tanks & a few large one with a good variety of fish local &
A lot of fishes and a nice place. Use google to visit it when is less crowded if you want take good pictures. Big parking space and place to drink a juice after visiting.

Combined this visit after the dinosaur park. The aquarium was clean, nice walk and good information about the habitants in different languages. Kids 4/6 had lots of fun watching the strange fish and got impressed by the sharks in the tank.

Really a lot to see. Fishes, crabs, medusas... very big fish tanks and detailed information in biggest world languages. They take good care about the animals. If you have children take them to this aquarium.
Really lovely place, well looked after and all animals seem cared for. Great place to take children or to visit with friends. Large variety of animals to see.
Very nice and interisting Place. Lots of people but no rush. Many different underwater animals, sharks was best!

Over the years I visited many aquariums in various cities, and I must say our visit to the Cretaquarium in Crete, Greece, was not a very good one. At first we thought it would be better, since the aquarium is located on the shores of the Mediterranean Sea with a sandy beach just

We came on our last day in heraklion to pass the day away we are so glad we did too. The creatures we saw were breathe taking so much to look at, very clean and tidy inside my kids loved it (2&5) and so did we!! The sharks were amazing to see so close & my favourite the turtle

So the entrance fee is €10 per adult and I do believe that’s all it’s worth. There are lots of different tanks with different fish and sea life in. Some seem a little small and some are not. They have a few sharks and lots of grouper fish. I found the jellyfish mesmerising.

2nd year running we decided to take a bit of time out of the sun and visited here. There are plenty of different tanks with different species in and lots of information about whats in each tank while you walk around. In typical aquarium setup there are lots of displays about

We visited this aquarium one afternoon as there was not a lot to do in Gouves as it was the start of the season. It is probably more suitable for families with kids. We are both senior citizens and enjoyed our time there. A bonus was that we got concessionary rates. I dont think

We were going to visit Dinolandia when we saw the sign for the Aquarium so we had a 2 in 1 day. My kids 6 and 10 really enjoyed it. They seen already bigger aquariums than this, but this was just sufficient for our trips. Not to tiring for them...and us. The fishes are local

My LO enjoys aquariums so felt this was a must visit for her and we were not disappointed. It was 10 euros to enter, and took about an hour to complete. It was informative in alot if different languages. There are lots of viewing areas too. Its also got a dinosaur park next

This was a pretty small aquarium from the one's I have been to in Canada, but still worth the visit! They accept student international cards (half price) here and accept all forms of payment. It was only about 2 hours from agia marina, where I was staying, and we ended up going
What a wonderful find on our holiday, we had so much fun and the cost was amazing. The facilities where great for families. a hidden (very hidden gem)

Great aquarium spent an hour there today very cheap to get in , layout was great and all information was provided with each fish species in many languages which was great . The sharks were awesome fair play. Bit of advice AVOID THE RESTAURANT we had 4 hamburgers which 3 were

We spent an enjoyable morning at the aquarium. It’s not huge, but very well laid out. Common names of each species are in multiple languages. Nice cafe with a variety of food and drinks. We ate outside. Afterwards we took walk along beach. We took public bus from Heraklion
All sea life is here: fishes, including big sharks, crabs, octopuses, sea horses, turtles, anemones and so on. All very well presented. Greta fun for adults and children.

Lots to see here. All kinds of fish, including massive sharks, crabs, seahorses, octopuses, turtles and so on. All very well-presented in big, clean tanks. A great experience for adults and children. At first I was a little sceptical about the €10 entrance fee, but it was

The weather was not so good so we decided to visit the Aqurium. The price was very reasonable 32 euros for 2 adults and 2 kids. There were quite a lot of different tanks with a large selection of creatures, including octipus, jelly fish, turtles, lobsters, sea horses, crabs,

Cretaquarim is a very nice place to visit while you are in Crete. It is located not far from Herklion and you can reach it even bus public bus (a 25 minute ride, cost: 2 Euros). The Cretaquarium gives comprehensive picture of underwater life in the Mediterranean. Explanations by

Stayed in Analipsi - got a taxi here on a rainy day, with low expectations - actually a great aquarium and worthy of an hour of your day here. Not much in the area though, so it's worth agreeing a taxi pickup time afterwards.

Small and disappointing for the price you pay (10 euro per adult). We went there with 3 years old child (free entrance). The big aquarium is beautiful. she wasn't interested in any thing else. You can spend here one hour, max.

Lots of fish species, a little bit expensive entrance ticket. It is open almost all days during the summer and there are sometimes many groups or schools so that could feel like crowdy. But I visited the aquarium during afternoon and it was great. I found it big and the pools
Went here as weather was not so good it was well worth the visit, good price, lots to see. Cafe had a good selection of food.

Rain, rain and more rain. Decided to take our 3 & 8 year old out and visited here. It was about 10 mins from our hotel and cost €10 in taxi, or €5.80 on local bus each way. Cost €10 per adult, €6 for child entrance fee - we purchased tickets from hotel reception and skipped a

We took a group of 5 (3-8 year olds) and they had a fun time. A few interactive exhibitions and things to do. Not as spectacular as some other aquariums around the world but reasonably priced and a good use of time if a wet/windy day.

We have visited the aquarium in January with not so many tourists so our experience was nice and not croudy. The entrance fee during winter period is 6 euro per person. The walk can be done within 30 minutes. There is a lots of small and some large aquariums with fish, sharks

Small quaint aquarium, not as expensive as the uk ones. We walked down the breach to it from Gouves if you have little kids I would recommend you take the little train to it which stops out side. All the tanks were clean the staff were really helpful nice little distraction.

Visited when we came to Crete in the October half term as the weather wasn’t great one day. Can’t say the aquarium here was anything special or to different to the ones we have in Norfolk. The sharks were good and the tanks were big. Tiny gift shop with no associated
Don’t waste your money. Tiny tanks over crowded complete nightmare. Dangerous to walk from bus stop. Don’t know how they get away with it.

This really is worth a visit when in Crete. As others have said, don’t be put off by the area. The barren land makes this place feel isolated but the aquarium really is good. November’s low season, so it was quiet, no queues and only €6 each to get in. We spent an hour and a

As other reviewers have said the outside area from the road to the aquarium is less than inviting, take no notice this is very affordable and will occupy at least 2 hours with toilets and reasonable café as part of complex. Discounts for oldies like me on showing passport but

It takes an hour for a quick tour but I took 2,5 hours to examine everything. Very nicely and user friendly exposed. I felt very pleased after the visits, The live shark collection and the skeleton jaws of several species were the most impressive.

Visited with my wife and 15 year old son. Surrounding area a bit run down but don't let this put you off. The aquarium is excellent with superb, clean, healthy fish tanks. It is also well worth paying a few euro extra for the virtual reality experience, a bit too real for my

Don’t be put off by the surroundings which look a bit run down, the aquarium is well worth a visit. Set on the site of an old military barracks near the sea, Cretaquarium is a modern aquarium with over 2000 marine inhabitants. This is the place to view a huge variety of fish,

nice place to go on wet day think we should have done the virtuial bit too but didn't. Bit off main road and not well sign posted but go past big car park by dinasour world and keep driving down little road towards beach. some tanks look empty but look close as a lot of small

We travelled by bus from Heraklion , it’s was a bit of a walk from the bus stop to the aquarium , but we knew about it and going through what seems to be a repurposed military base was quite interesting. Having read reviews I expected the aquarium to be a bit shabby. I was very
The aquarium is not very large so it doesn't take very long to visit. If you've been to other aquariums around the world it's probably not very impressive, but it kept our toddler entertained.

I had a car and on driving up to the place the whole area looks run down and closed - DO NOT let this put you off. A bit scruffy on the outside - inside the aquarium was amazing - loads to see loads to learn about and some very big sharks and other deep water fish.

Here you see fish that you couldn't imagine that they exist! For me was impressive especially the sharks which I so much love:p They upgraded it now as they added something with Virtual Reality now(which I haven't been) and some new fish!

We got to Heraklion earlier then expected to catch our ferry to Piraeus and decided to check out the Cretaquarium. We got there pretty late in the day and the place was almost empty of visitors. Our family had a wonderful time checking out the clean displays with lively fish.
Visited with my other half and 9 month old. Really nice aquarium a couple of big sharks and nice ambience. Walking distance from Gouves and currently off peak so only 6€ for adult rather than 9€.
Loved it, very rich of species. Especially loved the jellyfish tank. It was somehow very magical and hypnotic. And little baby nemos were also cute.
We loved our visit to the aquarium, very rich species of fish and turtles! It s very nice for kids also!

It’s not your typical seen one seen them all sealife centre. It was different to that. Surprising shark tank and just lived the jelly fish. We are not talking sea world standard here but definitely up there with the smaller uk aquariums. Well worth the visit.

To be fair, Greece does not have a tradition in aquaria, so this is not such a bad effort. However, the tanks are rather small and the fish variety rather limited. Educational material for children is minimal, and labeling / background info on the showcased is disappointing

Cretaquarium is located in an area that looks quite abandoned. The facility itself is quite dated and charges €9 for adult entry. We found ourself finishing the entire aquarium at about 1hour. The species shown aren’t any other and in my opinion even more limited then aquariums
I think it’s one of the best aquariums in Europe. You can see many kinds of sea creatures and they take care of them very good. Very good for children also.
Typical of similar aquariums around the world. It's clean, bright and informative. It's good value for money and a good way to spend a couple of hours.

Entry is €9 per adult with €12 for entry with a 3D experience (which we didn’t opt for). The aquarium is in an old USA army base and a good idea for reusing the site. There is free parking nearby with an on-site cafe and restaurant. The exhibits are good with a great main ta k
Did have huge expectations but it was fantastic and the whole family 12 yrs - 74 yrs old all loved it.

We took our children to the Aquarium during our holiday. My son has additional needs and the staff were very supportive. We really enjoyed the visit, some really interesting exhibits. We loved the sharks!

Big and nice aquarium. It's worth to see. Easily accessible with local bus but the bus does not go down to the aquarium so you have to walk a lot from the bus stop. If you arrive with local bus you can buy the tickets cheaper and without queueing at the bus stop from a person
Nice place with many kind of fish, there is a restaurant if you are hungry, and a nice shop to buy some souvenirs
The aquarium is pretty oool, there's a nice variety of sea life to see. The VR experience is also pretty cool, worth the visit.
Unlike Dinosauria nearby (which is dreadful) this is a great venue. Wonderful displays of fish and other aquatic creatures. Clean, interactive, and fun.
was near out hotel so we took a look. Really nice place, with big variety and well organized . Good for all ages .

We went to the auarium by bus from heraklion. You can buy a discount ticket to the aquarium in the central bus station or, where the bus stops. From where the bus stop you need to walk about one kilometer. The aquarium is not to big. We spent about an hour. Nice display of
Went here with our 2 year old . The place is great, a lot to see. Their fish collection is very impressive. There are also some pretty big sharks. The entire family enjoyed it.
Very nice, lots of species, clean and well organized area. Very nice for children, as they were impressed.

This was one of the best aquariums I have ever been to. It was ashame about the screaming kids but thats normal and nothing to do with this amazing place. It was very busy though. So much to see. The surrounding area is falling apart and it would make a great USA airforce

We went with our 3 years old boy, it is about 45-60 minutes. the fish are very nice, and there is a great view of 2 giant sharks and some other fish. there is a parking lot close by which is free. and a place to buy snakes/food/ice cream and drinks at the end. it costs 9 euros
Visited with our 4 year old, spent a good few hours here. Lots to see and very intresting. The sharks and turtles are a highlight. Worth the price and the trip out.
It's a 5-10 minutes walk from the bus stop,catching the bus gets you a 1€ discount. Spent 2 hours wondering around the exhibits. Excellent value for money. Will entertain both young and old.

Well organized, huge and amazing variety of sea animals. Absolutely loved the seals. I thought the time you were expected to spend at the Aquarium was going to be too long but we spent almost 3 hours in there. Definitely to be recommended for young and old. Amazing!

Wide selection of sea creatures on display. Beautifully presented animals and plants including sharks, rays and jelly fish. Educative about sea pollution and wildlife protection. 1-1.5 hours are plenty to walk around. Recommended.

We had a great time in the aquarium! There are a lot to see and we enjoyed ourselves a lot, but our five year old did become somewhat bored after a while. Worth mentioning though is that we had just been at the other aquarium that is also a reptile rescue center and had “the

The owner of our apartment recommended we visit here. It's accessable on public bus, although quite a walk from the road It's situated on an old American Army base, the site is full of interesting abandoned buildings. The aquarium is housed in a large building near the sea. It
It’s quite a small aquarium but we still managed to spend 3 hours here. The sharks were amazing. They packed loads into a small space. There is also virtual reality but children under 12 can’t use it

We didn't expect much but were pleasantly surprised when we went in. A really good selection of marine life that you can see up close. I would definitely recommend a visit and it was good to get out of the heat. Don't let the abandoned army base on the way put you off!!

Really enjoyed our day trip here, in fact was one of the highlights of our holiday. Our toddler son had been very poorly & we needed an activity that was out of the sun - this was perfect. Spent a couple of hours wandering around and our son was mesmerised. Visited the cafe

If you need a break from the heat (you will!), the Cretaquarium is fantastic. It's small and I really wasn't expecting much to be honest (as we have visited huge aquariums all over the world), but was pleasantly surprised how much we all enjoyed (kids 10 & 13 at the time).

Nice and tidy! Large bassins and lots of sealive to see including huge sharks. Also very educational. They have self grown clown fishes (Nemo fishes). Didn’t know they were that small 😆. Adults prices are a bit high for this experience I think (8euro) but kids (4 euro) from 8

Not very much to enter and for the price you pay you get quite alot out if it. The fish seem to be well kept also there is a nice gift shop and an vr for children aged 12 or over, only problem is the amount of people.
Visited this as part of a tour. Smaller than expected however plenty to see. Very clean and tidy and great viewing points. Great place to pass some time and for young children.

Visited July 2018, very well put together aquarium with lots to see, excellent value for money too at 9 Euros per person, worthy of a second visit to appreciate everything there is on offer here to see and learn about. Many languages are catered for, some nice quirks and a very

We went here from Agios Nicolaos as a part of a short trip to Hersonisos. I'd say we enjoyed the experience. The aquarium is not huge, but not small either. There are plenty interesting and fascinating species to see (even though there are also some boring fish to be honest).

Had a lovely visit round the aquarium. Lots to see, the tanks are all clear and easily accessible for children of all ages. They cater for many languages, with all tanks/displays translated in many of the popular tourist languages. Perfect for a couple of hours if you want
If you are a fan of the sea world, then this is the one place you have to visit in Crete. The second biggest aquarium in Europe. Great range of fishes in a very good location

I’ve visited a lot of European aquaria and this one is okay. It’s good to see they have an exhibit about plastic pollution but it isn’t very prominent. They have a good range of species and some interesting information. The multi language labels also help to appreciate the

I have been to almost all aquariums in Europe and I can tell that this one has it all. It has all Mediterranean species, turtle's, shark, clean beautiful, big. If you haven't been to an aquarium before you will love it, if you have been before to londons or Berlin... it is

Decided to visit the aquarium as recommended in top 10 attractions. The aquarium is average compared to the sea life centres in the U.K. However there were some impressive displays and creatures. Our favourite was the octopus and clown fish

Beautiful place with various Mediterranean Sea fish. Quite hot inside, air conditioning was not working. We have visited it in the afternoon on Wednesday. Not too much people inside. Possible to have a guide for extra money. Besides parking for the car.
It was our first-time experience in aquarium. And we liked it. We spent there about one hour. We made a beautiful pictures of sharks, other unseen fishes, octopus. It was a cool time in heat.

Went here with my family. Two kids 2 and 6. Completely fascinated with this place. Not too expensive and well worth a visit. Lots of species of sea creatures with some huge tanks. The two HUGE sharks are amazing. Never seen anything like it. The kids loved them. Spent around 90
Very nice place with a lot of fishes, with children for aprx one hour trip. Aircondition place. We enjoy it.

Good view into life under water in the Mediterrenean sea . Nice also for children,not too crowded (on a summer's monday). Also possible with baby stroller. Restaurant is rather a snackbar,but enough for a quick refreshment.
Very well organized and very close to Heraklion. Audio device (extra charge) is well worth the money to those who want some more marine life details. Clean and nicely presented !!!

It takes around 30min to see everything and there are not so many things to see. We feel the value received is not so good for the money paid.

Had a most enjoyable visit! Thourghly reccomend giving this place a go. Not overly expensive and I learnt a considerable amount while I was there! There is a cafe on site and free parking. There is also a taxi rank outside.

Now I know I’m 30 years of age...but I don’t mind admitting that I flippin’ LOVE sharks! I just find them fascinating! So even though we had already visited the smaller Aquaquarium in Hersonissos (definitely worth a visit by the way!) I dragged my poor other half to Cretaquariun
Worth a visit.Go and see the great variety of sea creatures.Prepare to spend a couple of hours there.

Excellent place for a short outing with small children, kids enjoyed it. Well maintained and clean tanks. 9€ per adult felt like a reasonable price. Not too big making it adequate for children to walk around in about 1h-1h30. Went by taxi from Creta Maris Hotel (Hersonissos),

Even if you stay further away, rent a car or take a bus to go there. Totally worth it. Fan-tas-tic! Some of the fish tanks have seats infront of them so you can sit down and watch. Mesmerizing, soothing, interesting, beautiful. Can't really say how long it takes. If you are

I really liked it. We've visited this place with our 3 y.o. son and he loved everything there :) Some of animals were injured, unfortunately, but all in all it was still interesting to watch all the water creatures.
We enjoyed watching all the reptiles and particularly the sharks. We visited the place by car, but it would have been easy to go there by bus as well.

This an interesting and well laid out aquarium. It's not huge and you could run through it in 45 minutes but would you. The fish and sharks are great to see and fantastic to sit and watch, especially if you get a quiet moment with No hyper excited kids around. Kids will

The truth is that there are not many aquariums in Crete, so the competition is low, but anyway this aquarium worths a visit. It is designed with an interesting architecture, and although small, you can enjoy an 1-hour visit without feeling bored or fatigued. It is also kids
You must go here-WOW the best aquarium we have ever been too! Very well run and so interesting 🙂. So much to see -the kids loved it!!
Kids had a great time at the aquarium. Can take about 45 mins to an hour to see all the sections. The large shark tank was cool Clean place and plenty of parking.

We really enjoyed our visit to Cretaquarium. There was a great range of creatures that all looked well cared for. We especially loved the sharks. However, for the price to enter we expected it to be bigger and were shocked when we reached the end after less than an hour. We went

You are in for a real treat when you visit this place especially if there are children in your party. We went on a very warm day and it was a great respite from the heat. Large windows for seeing all the fish. Wide range of exhibits and information. We combined our visit with

We stayed within walking distance of the aquarium so it was the perfect place to visit on the one morning during our stay that it rained. We spent a couple of hours there. The entrance price 9Euros is well worth it and we appreciated the fact that they don't charge for young

It costs 9€ for an adult and 6€ if over 65 and is a great place to visit. The displays are great with useful signs and you can hire an audio tour. There are lots of different displays from jelly fish to sharks and some amazing tropical fish too. It takes around 1.5 hours to go

Stayed in Gouves which as a family with a small child.. quite honestly became very boring.. so we walked along the seafront for an hour and came across this place.. the place was very clean and well run.. entrance fee was only €9. Each and my son was free.. breathtaking place..

Great visit even for adults . Lots of marine life to see enjoyed seeing the sharks, turtle & octopus. Could have sat watching the many fish for ages. Information available next to each aquarium , also a gift shop as you leave. Afterwards we had a slice of pizza and a drink in

Yes the title has full meaning for Crete's Unique place, amazing species of maritime world of Crete available to see, and observe in a great environment. Nothing to envy from other south European Aquariums.. Well Done!
Interesting and diverse aquarium. Loved the octopus and turtles. Beautifully maintained and reasonably priced. Only 6 euros per person.

Recently visited this little gem while on hols. Only 6 euros each to get in (think sign read 9 euros for adults in high season). Although not a huge aquarium it's still great value for money, lots to see and do, friendly staff, very good and clean facilities. Information about
Out of season it's 6 euros per adult and well worth it, there is a lot to see, many varieties of marine life, very interesting good location as well right by a good beach. Would definitely recommend.

Very nice place with big aquariums and fishes inside. Very relaxing place and amazing for children. Entrance is only 6€ and small children are free of charge. You can spend 1-2 hours and there are a restorant as well.

Only €6pp entrance fee we weren’t expecting much, but was well worth the money. There’s plenty of tanks to view the sea life and lots of interesting information. The toilets were scrupulously clean and staff warm and friendly. However, the gift shop was disappointing with lots
Great place for young and older kids. We’ve been there for almost 3 hours, plenty of sea creatures and fish.

Cretaquarium was part of our trip with children from the beach stereotyp. Reachable by a regular bus line on the Cretan motorway. As i heard it is made on places of former american base. For corresponding entrance fee were there lot of acquariums also high volumes with lot of

Quite big aquarium with lots of species of sea/ocean inhabitants. The main attraction - big pool with various fishes including several sharks. The aquarium uses 3D technology in some of the exhibitions, also one 3D interactive game can be played by children in one of the
One of the best things to do in Crete. Very impressive Christmas show with santa Claus and mermaid Evriali...IMPRESSIVE
Walk in the world of undersea animals in a very nice place. I recommend taking a look, it is very interesting and not far from the capital city.

I went with my daughter to Cretaquarium this November. It's a little difficult to locate the place. The scenery from outside is a little disappointed but when you enter the building the exploration of the sea world calls you ... We spend 1 hour there - it's so nice to see and

Interesting place, little bit small. Sharks, fish, turtles. Even the aquarium is small you can get good photos of animals.

Small selection of sea mammals. Keep away at busy time unless you enjoy shoals of children. Easy to get too on the Heraklion to Malia road - lots of buses only €2. Big car park or 5 minute walk from bus stop. Old US military bases with lots of derelict buildings to walk past.
Its a very nice place for a short afternoon visit. Its not the best in the world but its good enough for a few hours during a vacation. Nice big Sharks aquarium.
I went here with my whole familya few days ago and we all enjoyed it..there are lots of different sea creatures, including sharks and lots of tropical species. Ideal for kids!

It's always a nice idea to visit an acquarium when traveling with children, instructing and funny. This one is nice to visit, easy to reach (having a car) and all in all a good choice for a day. Mainly with Mediterranean species, but not exclusively, so it's almost interesting

I have been to a few aquariums and I have to say both myself and the kids thought this was excellent. Some lovely big tanks, well laid out with sharks , jellyfish, turtles, Eels , fish, octopuses , cuttlefish etc. A very reasonable entrance fee as well. Takes about an hour to an

We spent a hour here and saw a lot of variety of sea life.Its not as big as the Barcelona aquarium but still worth a visit ,kids will definitely like it here some nice big tanks and set out to keep the flow of people moving.You wouldn't need more than a hour and a half there
long walk for not a lot.carried on to dinosaur world just as bad . very cheap and it showed.charged for other things when inside …

One of the best aquariums I have ever visited. And since it is a sea aquarium mikes it even better. You can see a variety of meditteranean fishes, from tiny ones to sharks. Very well displayed and there is enough information for every species. Bravo.
Cool place to spend an hour- hour and a half max! Very small compare to Eilat and other similar places in Europe Close to the city center

This was fun and we didn't even go with kids! There's plenty to see and the big tanks are impressive. You'll only need an hour or so to see everything. What I found a bit more interesting is that the aquarium is on an old US Air Base and you have to walk past all the old
Normally very busy, however was a great day !! Staff were every friendly and were very good English speakers
Visited the place with kids of 3, 6 and 10 years of age and all of them had a lot of fun. Great variety of sea creatures including sharks. The place is small enough to cover in 1-1.5 hours.

If you are in Crete with children it is a must to visit. Easy to reach by bus (station: Aquarium), and then 5 mins walk towards the sea. Worth buying combined ticket and see the side exhibition about ancient greek inventions too.

The Aquarium was such a fun visit! Firstly the ticket prices were very cheap and for only a few extra euro you could visit the Greek History Expedition which was also being held there. There were many different types of fish and there were in very big tanks so the fish had lots
It is really interesting place, have a lot of interesting animal. Just the aquarium is a bit small. But i liked it, especially jelly-fishs.

Take a tour around the areas of the Aquarium Each tank of CretAquarium bears labels with hosted species’ names printed in nine languages (Greek, English, French, German, Italian, Dutch, Polish, Russian, Czech). Additionally, during your tour around the corridors of the
We were there with our kids. A lot of aquariums with different kind of fish. Nice display of big sharks. Was surprised to see an aquarium full of jellyfish.
We were passing here anyway and it was an unusually cloudy day. Killed an hour and was a nice way from the driving. My partner had never been to an aquarium so we really enjoyed it :)

There are a lot of different types of animals such as fishes, sharks, turtles, scorpions and so on. It's very interesting for children, a lot of information about the animals. It's worth to go if you have children or you weren't before in an aquarium.

Visiting this aquarium is an interesting experience that you can combine with the rest of your family vacations. Kids really liked it. Their restaurant can get a lot better. However, the staff is very friendly.
We had a fantastic day out here. Lots to see and well laid out. My only (small) criticism would be that some of the information boards could do with being a little better illuminated.

It's a brilliant attraction to visit on Crete if you get the chance. There's various sizes of tanks with a beautiful array of aquatic species from green turtles to colourful rasps and massive sand sharks to tiny octopi. Well worth a visit.
Really lovely, much bigger than expected! Would highly recommend! Fabulous, clean and well kept! Worth a visit! Not overly expensive either! Adults €9 teenagers €6

Great work and layout. Fantastic to see the breadth of marine life. Definitely suggest getting the Audio Guide.
Impresive collection of sea species. Well worth the visit. Spend an hour to see the whole place. Could have spend more. Great place.

A superb aquarium with 60 tanks, well laid out. Plenty of different marine species to see. Some very large tanks with the usual sharks etc. Nice clean new building, bit of a walk in the heat from the main road bus stop. Plenty of taxis waiting to whisk you away if you don't

Fabulous, the tanks seem nice and large for the fish, with big viewing areas so you don't have to fight for space to see the fish. There was a huge variety of fish on display. I loved the gallery style seats where you could just sit and watch the fish. Despite the temptation

We've visited there during our stay, A nice short visit, A lot of variety of fishes, There was also an ancient greek Technology exhibit in 2 euro extra, you can skip that, You can spend there an hour or two

The aquarium was pretty nice but it wasn't a one hour visit. More like 45 minutes. As it is in a sea area I was expecting a bit more for the buck. The aquarium in Hannover is better, how can that be?
Nice collection of fish. They have two species of shark. Worth a visit if you're near. Nothing else to add.

Quite interesting place for children. Maybe also for parents, but we were expecting the Cretaquarium to be more big.
This was a welcome break from the heat. Quite reasonably priced and interesting . We got some nice photos of fish. It took us about an hour to go round. Cafe pleasant afterwards .
Well presented and with some nice looking modern tanks, great variety of species but nothing exactly ground breaking, if your looking to entertain the little ones then its a safe bet.

We found the aquarium a good way to kill an hour or so as it was a short walk for us but I doubt it worth travelling a long way for. 9 euros per adult, 6 for children. No real need to pay three euros for the audio guide.

We went with my 4 yo son and my wife. The aquarium is well organized and there are a lot of tanks to spent time. Next to each tank there are tags for the fish inside. Overall its a nice visit and kids will like it.

The Cretaquarium is a lovely place with some nice things to see. We went as a family and walked the 20 or so minutes from the centre of Gouves along the front. Having been to both the Blue Planet and a couple of the larger Sealife centres in Britain this doesn't quite match up,

Small but nicely organized aquarium with some interesting multimediatic insertions. The main attraction is the white shark in a modern pool that allows him to swim above the visitors. Interesting and in some passes also educational for children.

In no particular order, this place is very accessible, unpatronizing, clean and worth your while and money. Sharks are awesome. Good way to spend 1-2 hours, sip some drinks, take some photos and move on. Do not miss the little turtles slideshow demonstration.

9 Euro's each well spent, airconditioned, fantastic clean and clear glass tanks, a great couple of hours if it interests you👍🏻
A new aquarium with the usual attractions- shark pools, local sea-life. Explanations in English. Worth visiting.

Can't compare with the big name aquaria of the world but they don't have the budget or audience either. Informative about Mediterranean if you are natural history buff and worth a visit if you have kids and need a half day away from the beach. I've been to several of the big

Not Bad but seemed to have decreased in size compared to our visit last year. The shop has gone?? Not sure that's a good move, or are they deliberately running it down... it's a pity if they are because this really did show what can be found in the Chetan sea.
Not so great,pic inside without flash so almost dark, but if you have seen other around you can skip this. Nothing wow !!

While we enjoyed the aquarium and our 4 year old boys found it enjoyable for a while, it was a little bit boring. As much as I like seeing animals, I was a bit bored. It isn't huge and you can walk around it in about 1 hour. The surrounding area is weird - it is a deserted

Not so impressive as some aquariums across Europe. But good enough to spend few hours with kids instead of one of your beach days. Sharks and jellyfishes included.

nice place but very quickly you get bored. no guide to explain about the fishes. nothing like the one in eilat in israel that is much better

A great place to be with kids if you are looking for a break from the heat and sunburning for a half a day. Reaaally interesting and amazing creatures to see and learn about them together with children. A great money spent. Totally worth it.

We needed a break from the heat and decided to go here. What a great surprise. The variety of animals kept us all entertained for about an hour. ] We also loved that they are using the space of the old US military sight. Great use of space.

From the outside it doesn't seems to be a VERY big attraction. But just step inside and start to look around, and you will know, IT IS! Nicely composed fish tanks and displays, real and healthy looking fishes. And so on... Very good holiday activity with children.
It's a great experience, there are many tourists, but it's ok. Many species of fish, here I first saw a shark, turtle Carreta - Carreta protected by law.

With just 9 hours in crete, we checked out the Things to do on tripadvisor and saw cretaquiarium. We came here by bus. The aquarium is located inside the ex us Military base. so it was a long walk from the main street going to the aquairum. maybe 10-15 mins walk. We didnt

We visited here at the beginning of june and the whole family enjoyed it. We went mid morning so it wasn't too busy. Plenty to see and good range of information on the different spieces in lots of different languages. My lasses (8 & 12) were fascinated by all the different
Was totally amazed really worth a visit. When i seen the sharks teeth . It made me scared to go for a swim

If you ignore the long scary walk through deserted buildings from the bus to the aquarium, it's a nice experience
Enjoyed a morning t the aquarium. Got there early when it was quiet. Plenty of fish to see in a clean and well kept facility

Visited here with teens and a 6 year old, and it was enjoyed by all. Lots of information on all the exhibits and some interactive displays too. Educational or just great for anyone interested in marine life. It is limited in size so not a full day out, but a good place to spend
Didn't take long to walk around but amazing fish to look at. Gift shop was closed sadly but ate in restaurant and lovely food

Sharks were great, very cool atmosphere, a place must to visit! we really have great photos there...

Easy to reach, great price, beautiful variety, kids loved it! I recommend taking 1-2 hours and really looking at the aquarium and reading the text. It can be very educational for both adults and children.

seeing sharks close up was a real treat there were plenty of lovely fish a fabulous turtle --air conditioned which was good as very hot 35degrees day place to eat and drink

We were staying in Analipsi and we hired a car for a few days to explore the area. We came to Gournes and wouldn't have stopped but for the fact that I have a hobby called geocaching and there was a geocache outside of the aquarium. We parked up and found the geocache. Terry
Great place to visit with small kids. Has a lot of "material" to observe. Only wear some warmer clothes, inside is dark and a bit chilly.

This was less than five minutes drive from where we stayed but would have travelled much further to make this visit. Well worth a visit with younger family and the sight of local kids enjoying the aquarium was a pleasure.

Really small and really repetitive. Genuinely the worst aquarium I've ever been to. We were going to go to Aquaworld but wasn't able to get there. Wouldn't recommend however the cafe/restaurant was lovely.

visited this aquarium with my 9 year old son and mother whilst on holiday in stalls. we got a taxi from our hotel to the aquarium which was slightly expensive but he waited the whole 2 hours for us and didn't charge us anything extra in fact he knocked a few euros off!! we spend
Was not wothwhile visiting. Not much to see. Maybe it's because we were at the aquarium in Atlanta and expected a little more.

We visited this lovely attraction on the third day of our holiday. What a fantastic few hours we spent there. Much to see and do and our little 5 year old daughter was amazed by all the different sea life. Would recommend this to any of the island visitors.
For only 9 Euros per person, this attraction was great value for money all going towards the conservation of marine life.

Great aquarium with a variety of fish to see. It provides information of the animals in several different languages which is useful. There is also a sea food restuarant at the end with good food which is a nice way to end the trip.

My friend and I spent a good couple of hours in the Aquarium on a rainy day. Despite it being a rainy day, the Aquarium was rather quiet which was nice. The attraction is reasonably priced and easily accessible by bus from Heraklion.

Generally enjoy these type of places although one is pretty similar to another. The sand sharks were impressive. Aware from earlier comment that the gift shop was shut and that seemed a shame as there were plenty of people there, including local school trips, and much revenue

This aquarium is very good. It has different species, including sharks, turtles, jellyfish, and cuttlefish. The aquariums for the most part are well put together, and it is a nice and peaceful adventure. The cafe was good for lunch. To get there, purchase bus tickets at the bus

It wasn't the greatest aquarium we got round it within half an hour this just wasn't for me I expected more and I felt sorry for the animals because the tanks seemed so small

Very interesting - lots of incredible fish and some pretty spectacular sharks too! There is also a little cinema showing interesting marine life films. Good for kids, and to get out of the sun for a while... Only 6 Euros to get in.
Very good visit was very warm outside so nice and cool in side vety intetesting a reallg good few hours out .

Good morning out at the aquarium. Very reasonable admission charges. Plenty of varied sea life creatures. Be sure to take your camera.
At the Cretaquarium, one can observe the world beneath the waves without even getting his feet wet. This is found at the old US military base in the Gournes district.

This is a nice aquarium, although the price for an audioguide (3) is a bit strange as there were a lot of numbers not working. Mainly in the beginning the tanks are nice and big, but further down the line i sorta lost interest. It's okay afterall.

You can visit the aquarium, you can see impressive pools, sharks and other marine animals.Visit the aquarium in Hersonissos

an amazing experience of shark - fish - medusa viewing, a must-see attraction of Heraklion. Beware of the sharks lurking behind the huge tanks.
Very nice aquarium! Quite big for crete which is great! Many species, and a lot of interactive things to do!

Very beautiful Aquarium... i loved it very much... a diversity of fishes... you can enjoy the experience of meetting different type of fish.. very lovely place.. after the Aquarium a walk on the beach will be a excellent end to your 2 hours... Entrance fees 6 euros

A trip to the aquarium on a cloudy day is perfect to kill a day with no sun or if you need a break from the sun during an hour or two. Interesting and nice to see the fish population of the Mediterranean Sea.

It's worth to go there!A lot of different kind of animals to see. We took many beautiful photos. We enjoyed that place a lot! I really reccomend to go there if you are close to Heraklion/Hersonissos!
Nice aquarium, good place to visit children. Also has a cafe on site with OK food. Salads not inspiring! Great shark tank. Good place to visit.
This Aquarium is well kept and has several aquatic species, it is great fun for small children. The aquarium is quite large and definitely one of the fun things to do while in Crete!
Clean and nice, fair price, not so big and not a lot of special fish, but we spent there few hours and enjoyed it. It's far from the bus station and taxies are very expensive.

The place is nice, the kids will like it. I've seen there some fish that I've never seen before, but the place is small and the exhibit is very short.. Generally, I recommend it but come with average expectations.
Had a really lovely day out - sharks, rays, turtles, sea horses, eels, spider crabs and all sorts of colourful tropical fish. Very nice modern environment, unhurried.
We felt like children again! It was a great chance to see all types of sea creatures. The ticket wasn't cheap but it was a wonderful way to spend our afternoon.
We spent about an hour and found it really good and our daughter (8) loved it 18 euro for 2 adults and a child

Took a trip here and thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. With loads of exhibits very well presented this is a great choice for both adults and children alike. At the end there is a theatre presentation which most seemed to avoid but was worth the watch and very interesting.

Well worth the visit, though signposted, however if on your own may find it a bit difficult to find. Reasonable entry charges, kids less than 4 go free. There is also an audio guide available and my 8 year old daughter found it very useful. Easy to navigate, good collection,

You just walk through a maze of aquarium tanks and look at fish through glass. It was good for us trying to kill a day. Not worth a special trip to see it.

I've been there three times and each time I love it even more! It's a beautiful aquarium with a great variety of fish and species. I'll go there again in the future.

We went there with my wife and our 5-year old kid. Although it was off season the installations and the whole experience were in an excellent shape. Service was good and the museum itself is an amazing attraction. Many things for children to see and learn.

My 5 year old son liked it, although it was off season and most of the species and exhibits are mediterranean. We visited a Friday afternoon, one hour before closing time, so we were practically alone. It's big enough to keep you interested. A decent try which is worth visiting
Its a wonderful place to visit for all the family, with many different kind of fishes, i fully recommend this place for everyone! !!

We came across the aquarium as we was having a stroll along the beach. Reasonably priced and a good day out would recommend to family's and couples. It is quite big so it takes a while to get round but it's a nice thing to do to change your holiday up rather than always be out

Recommended to us from relatives to visit the aquarium.It was very beautiful, an alternative to a museum.Quite lot to see, but i would like morethe tickets were not too expensive.I think for the summer the adults is 9euro each and in the the winter 6euro.Kids up to 4 years old

We have spent about 2h in the aquarium and got a decent snack at the cafeteria which is at the entrance. Based on some of the mixed reviews we didn't have that high expectations, but at the end we were thrilled - it's really nice and clean place with a very calming atmosphere.
.- Nice place for visit ~ 2-3 hours . Ideal if the weather is rainy including exhibition of sharks, and amazing colored tropical fishes
It was a decent aquarium, I've been to better ones. We spent 2 hours their entertaining a toddler killing time before the airport and it helped to keep him occupied so all in all a worth while trip.

We visited here with our young children and we all really enjoyed it! Lots to see and there's a place to eat there and a lovely gift shop. My daughters like the turtles the most! Also the dinosauria park just along the road is a must see for families with children too!

We visit many aquariums and this was a good one. It was interesting to learn the species of all the fish we had been seeing while snorkeling. There was lots of lobsters and sea breams. Nice for an afternoon out.

We visited the aquarium in the afternoon, we arrived by taxi the driver said he would return in 45 mins as it wouldn't take long to look around and he was right. Resonable price to get in a nice range of diplays but thats about it, it wasn't inspiring but ok for an afternoon

The place is full of different fish species. Definitely sharks aquarium is the main attraction, but there is many interesting to see beside the sharks. 6 euro isn't a big price and the place worth a visit

text.wiki:
Heraklion or Iraklion ( hih-RAK-lee-ən; Greek: Ηράκλειο, Irákleio, pronounced [iˈraklio]) is the largest city and the administrative capital of the island of Crete and capital of Heraklion regional unit. It is the fourth largest city in Greece with a population of 211,370 (Urban Area) according to the 2011 census. The population of the municipality was 173,993.The Bronze Age palace of Knossos, also known as the Palace of Minos, is located nearby.
Heraklion was Europe's fastest growing tourism destination for 2017, according to Euromonitor, with an 11.2% growth in international arrivals. According to the ranking, Heraklion was ranked as the 20th most visited region in Europe, as the 66th area on the Planet and as the 2nd in Greece for the year 2017, with 3.2 million visitors and the 19th in Europe for 2018, with 3.4 million visitors.


== Names ==
The Arab traders from al-Andalus (Iberia) who founded the Emirate of Crete moved the island's capital from Gortyna to a new castle they called rabḍ al-ḫandaq (Arabic: ربض الخندق‎, "Castle of the Moat") in the 820s. This was hellenized as Χάνδαξ (Chándax) or Χάνδακας (Chándakas) and Latinized as Candia, which was taken into other European languages: in Italian and Latin as Candia, in French as Candie, in English as Candy, all of which could refer to the island of Crete as a whole as well as to the city alone; the Ottoman name was Kandiye.
After the Byzantine reconquest of Crete, the city was locally known as Megalo Kastro (Μεγάλο Κάστρο, 'Big Castle' in Greek) and its inhabitants were called Kastrinoi (Καστρινοί, "castle-dwellers").
The ancient name Ηράκλειον was revived in the 19th century and comes from the nearby Roman port of Heracleum ("Heracles's city"), whose exact location is unknown. English usage formerly preferred the classicizing transliterations "Heraklion" or "Heraclion", but the form "Iraklion" is becoming more common.


== History ==


=== Minoan Era ===
Heraklion is close to the ruins of the palace of Knossos, which in Minoan times was the largest centre of population on Crete. Knossos had a port at the site of Heraklion (at Poros - Katsambas neighborhood) from the beginning of Early Minoan period (3500 to 2100 BC). Between 1600 and 1525 BC, the port was destroyed by a volcanic tsunami from nearby Santorini, leveling the region and covering it with ash.


=== Antiquity ===

After the fall of the Minoans, Heraklion, as well as the rest of Crete in general, fared poorly, with very little development in the area. Only with the arrival of the Romans did some construction in the area begin, yet especially early into Byzantine times the area was abound with pirates and bandits.


=== Emirate of Crete ===
The present city of Heraklion was founded in 824 by the Arabs under Abu Hafs Umar who had been expelled from Al-Andalus by Emir Al-Hakam I and had taken over the island from the Eastern Roman Empire. They built a moat around the city for protection, and named the city rabḍ al-ḫandaq (ربض الخندق, "Castle of the Moat", hellenized as Χάνδαξ, Chandax). It became the capital of the Emirate of Crete (ca. 827–961). The Saracens allowed the port to be used as a safe haven for pirates who operated against Imperial (Byzantine) shipping and raided Imperial territory around the Aegean.


=== Byzantine era ===

In 960, Byzantine forces under the command of Nikephoros Phokas, later to become Emperor, landed in Crete and attacked the city. After a prolonged siege, the city fell in March 961. The Saracen inhabitants were slaughtered, the city looted and burned to the ground. Soon rebuilt, the town remained under Byzantine control for the next 243 years.


=== Venetian era ===
 
In 1204, the city was bought by the Republic of Venice as part of a complicated political deal which involved, among other things, the Crusaders of the Fourth Crusade restoring the deposed Eastern Roman Emperor Isaac II Angelus to his throne. The Venetians improved on the ditch of the city by building enormous fortifications, most of which are still in place, including a giant wall, in places up to 40 m thick, with 7 bastions, and a fortress in the harbour. Chandax was renamed Candia and became the seat of the Duke of Candia, and the Venetian administrative district of Crete became known as "Regno di Candia" (Kingdom of Candia). The city retained the name of Candia for centuries and the same name was often used to refer to the whole island of Crete as well. To secure their rule, Venetians began in 1212 to settle families from Venice on Crete. The coexistence of two different cultures and the stimulus of Italian Renaissance led to a flourishing of letters and the arts in Candia and Crete in general, that is today known as the Cretan Renaissance.


=== Ottoman era ===

During the Cretan War (1645–1669), the Ottomans besieged the city for 21 years, from 1648 to 1669, perhaps the longest siege in history. In its final phase, which lasted for 22 months, 70,000 Turks, 38,000 Cretans and slaves and 29,088 of the city's Christian defenders perished. The Ottoman army under an Albanian grand vizier, Köprülü Fazıl Ahmed Pasha conquered the city in 1669. 
Under the Ottomans, Kandiye (Ottoman Turkish قنديه) was the capital of Crete (Girit Eyâleti) until 1849, when Chania (Hanya) became the capital, and Kandiye became a sancak. In Greek, it was commonly called Megalo Castro (Μεγάλο Κάστρο 'Big Castle').
During the Ottoman period, the harbour silted up, so most shipping shifted to Chania in the west of the island.


=== Modern era ===
In 1898, the autonomous Cretan State was created, under Ottoman suzerainty, with Prince George of Greece as its High Commissioner and under international supervision. During the period of direct occupation of the island by the Great Powers (1898–1908), Candia was part of the British zone. At this time, the city was renamed "Heraklion", after the Roman port of Heracleum ("Heracles' city"), whose exact location is unknown.
In 1913, with the rest of Crete, Heraklion was incorporated into the Kingdom of Greece. Heraklion became again capital of Crete in 1971, replacing Chania.


== Architecture, urban sculpture and fortifications ==

Venetian constructions such as the Koules Fortress (Castello a Mare), the ramparts and the arsenal dominate the port area.
Several sculptures, statues and busts commemorating significant events and figures of the city's and island's history, like El Greco, Vitsentzos Kornaros, Nikos Kazantzakis and Eleftherios Venizelos can be found around the city.
Many fountains of the Venetian era are preserved, such as the Bembo fountain, the Priuli fountain, Palmeti fountain, Sagredo fountain and Morosini fountain (in Lions Square).
Around the historic city center of Heraklion there are also a series of defensive walls, bastions and other fortifications which were built earlier in the Middle Ages, but were completely rebuilt by the Republic of Venice. The fortifications managed to withstand the longest siege in history for 21 years, before the city fell to the Ottomans in 1669.


== Municipality ==

The municipality Heraklion was formed at the 2011 local government reform by the merger of the following 5 former municipalities, that became municipal units:
Gorgolainis
Heraklion
Nea Alikarnassos
Paliani
TemenosThe municipality has an area of 244.613 km2, the municipal unit 109.026 km2.

== Transportation ==


=== Port ===
Heraklion is an important shipping port and ferry dock. Travellers can take ferries and boats from Heraklion to destinations including Santorini, Ios Island, Paros, Mykonos, and Rhodes. There are direct ferries to Naxos, Karpathos, Kasos, Sitia, Anafi, Chalki and Diafani. There are also several daily ferries to Piraeus, the port of Athens in mainland Greece. The port of Heraklion was built by Sir Robert McAlpine and completed in 1928.


=== Airport ===
Heraklion International Airport, or Nikos Kazantzakis Airport is located about 5 kilometres (3 miles) east of the city. The airport is named after Heraklion native Nikos Kazantzakis, a writer and a philosopher. It is the second busiest airport of Greece after Athens International Airport, first in charter flights and the 65th busiest in Europe, because of Crete being a major holiday destination with 7.974.887 travellers in 2018 (List of the busiest airports in Europe).
In April 2018, the inner space of the airport has been modernized and expanded by almost 3.000 s.m., with 11 new gates and new stores. The expansion was a donation by Hellenic Duty Free Shops.
The airfield is shared with the 126th Combat Group of the Hellenic Air Force.
A project for the new airport of Heraklion in Kasteli area is starting at the end of 2017.


=== Highway network ===
European route E75 runs through the city and connects Heraklion with the three other major cities of Crete: Agios Nikolaos, Chania, and Rethymno.


=== Public transit ===

Urban buses serving the city, with 39 different routes. Intercity buses connects Heraklion to many major destinations in Crete.


=== Railway ===
From 1922 to 1937, there was a working industrial railway, which connected the Koules in Heraklion to Xiropotamos for the construction of the harbor.
A study from the year 2000 investigated the feasibility of two tram lines in Heraklion. The first line would link the Stadium to the airport, and the second the center of Heraklion and Knossos.  No approval has yet been given for this proposal.
In the summer of 2007, at the Congress of Cretan emigrants, held in Heraklion, two qualified engineers, George Nathenas (from Gonies, Malevizi Province) and Vassilis Economopoulos, recommended the development of a railway line in Crete, linking Chania, Rethymno and Heraklion, with a total journey time of 50 minutes (30 minutes between Heraklion and Rethymno, 20 minutes from Chania to Rethymno) and with provision for extensions to Kissamos, Kastelli Pediados (for the planned new airport), and Agios Nikolaos. No plans exist for implementing this idea.


== Climate ==
Heraklion has a hot-summer-Mediterranean climate (Csa in the Köppen climate classification). Summers are warm to hot and dry with clear skies. Dry hot days are often relieved by seasonal breezes. Winters are very mild with moderate rain. Because Heraklion is further south than Athens, it has a warmer climate during winter but cooler during summer because of the Aegean sea. The maximum temperature during the summer period is usually not more than 28 - 30 °C (Athens normal maximum temperature is about 6 °C higher). The minimum temperature record is -0.2 °C
A new temperature record for February was set at 27.8 °C, reached on 15 February 2016.

=== Arts ===
The Cultural and Conference Center of Heraklion is a centre for the performing arts.


=== Sports ===
The city is home to several sports clubs. Most notably, Heraklion hosts OFI and Ergotelis, two football clubs with earlier presence in the Greek Superleague, the top tier of the Greek football league system. Furthermore, the city is the headquarters of the Heraklion Football Clubs Association, which administers football in the entire region. Other notable sport clubs include Iraklio B.C. (basketball), Atsalenios (football) and Irodotos (football) in the suburbs of Atsalenio and Nea Alikarnassos respectively.


=== Famous natives ===

Heraklion has been the home town of some of Greece's most significant people, including the novelist Nikos Kazantzakis (best known for Zorba the Greek), the poet and Nobel Prize winner Odysseas Elytis and the world-famous painter Domenicos Theotokopoulos (El Greco).

text.wiki:
Rethymno (Greek: Ρέθυμνο, [ˈreθimno], also Rethimno, Rethymnon, Réthymnon, and Rhíthymnos) is a city of little more than 30,000 people (near 40,000 for the municipal unit) in Greece, the capital of Rethymno regional unit on the island of Crete, a former Latin Catholic bishopric as Retimo(–Ario) and former Latin titular see.
Rethymno was originally built during the Minoan civilization (ancient Rhithymna and Arsinoe). The city was prominent enough to mint its own coins and maintain urban growth. One of these coins is today depicted as the crest of the town: two dolphins in a circle.


== History ==

This region as a whole is rich with ancient history, most notably through the Minoan civilisation centred at Knossos east of Rethymno. Rethymno itself began a period of growth when the Venetian conquerors of the island decided to put an intermediate commercial station between Heraklion and Chania, acquiring its own bishop and nobility in the process. Today's old town (palia poli) was almost entirely built by the Republic of Venice. It is one of the best-preserved old towns in Crete.
From circa 1250 the city was the seat of the Latin Diocese of Retimo, which was renamed Retimo–Ario after the absorption in 1551 of the Diocese of Ario and as suppressed only after the Turkish conquest.
The town still maintains its old aristocratic appearance, with its buildings dating from the 16th century, arched doorways, stone staircases, Byzantine and Hellenic-Roman remains, the small Venetian harbour and narrow streets. The Venetian Loggia houses the information office of the Ministry of Culture and Sports. A Wine Festival is held there annually at the beginning of July. Another festival, in memory of the destruction of the Arkadi Monastery, is held on 7–8 November.
The city's Venetian-era citadel, the Fortezza of Rethymno, is one of the best-preserved castles in Crete. Other monuments include the Neratze mosque (the Municipal Odeon arts centre), the Great Gate (Μεγάλη Πόρτα or "Porta Guora"), the Piazza Rimondi and the Loggia.
The town was captured by the Ottoman Empire in 1646 during the Cretan War (1645–69) and they ruled it for almost three centuries. The town, called Resmo in Turkish, was the centre of a sanjak (administrative part of a province) during Ottoman rule.
During the Battle of Crete (20–30 May 1941), the Battle of Rethymno was fought between German paratroopers and the Second Australian Imperial Force and Hellenic Army. Although initially unsuccessful, the Germans won the battle after receiving reinforcements from Maleme in the Northwestern part of the island.
Today the city's main income is from tourism, many new facilities having been built in the past 20 years.  Agriculture is also notable, especially for olive oil and other Mediterranean products.


== Municipality ==

The municipality of Rethymno was formed at the 2011 local government reform by the merger of the following 4 former municipalities, that became municipal units:
Arkadi
Lappa
Nikiforos Fokas
RethymnoPopulation of Rethymno 


== Culture ==
Rethymno is home to the following museums:

Archaeological Museum of Rethymno
Historical and Folklore Museum of Rethymno
Municipal Gallery "L. Kanakakis"
The Frantzeskaki Collection
Museum of Sea Life at Rethymno


=== Literature ===
Pandelis Prevelakis wrote Το χρονικό μιας πολιτείας (1937), The Chronicle of my Town, a nostalgic depiction of Rethymno from the period of the Cretan State (1898) to the expulsion of the Cretan Turks (1924).


=== Sports ===
Rethymno hosted the international athletics meeting known as Vardinogianneia. The athletics meeting stopped in 2012 due to Greek financial crisis. Rethymno has many sport clubs with presence in Panhellenic championships of various sports. Below is alist of the main sport clubs of Rethymno.


== Education ==
In the Rethymno Campus of the University of Crete are located the School of Philosophy, the School of Education, the School of Social, Economics and Political Sciences, and the University Library of the University of Crete. On a yearly basis, there are about 8.000 students studying at "Galos" where the Campus and the Academic Institute of Mediterranean Studies are located. Also in Rethymnon is located the School of Music and Optoacoustic Technologies of the Hellenic Mediterranean University.  Finally, in Rethymno, Tria Monastiria area is located the international research Institute of Plasma Physics and Laser of the Hellenic Mediterranean University which is the access point of the National Research Facility HELLAS-CH .

trip: The Municipal Art Gallery is hosted in the former “Saint Marcus” Basilica. It has thematic exhibitions featuring mainly contemporary Greek artists. Chances are to see something new every two months.

It is an old basilica, which resisted the earthquake that destroyed most of the island's buildings, which is now a municipal gallery. While we have been there, there was a very interesting exhibition of masks of human faces from various origins. It was a well spent time.

It's very close to the Lion Fountain in the center of Heraklion. Nice Venetian church but it is now used to display art. Worthwhile to go in for a few minutes to see the building's interior and whatever art is on display. No entrance fee.
Situated in Lions Square St Marks Basilica has very nice exhibitions with free entrance for culture lovers in Heraklion Crete.

This old Venetian church is in 25th August Street, between the Morosini Fountain and the Venetian Loggia. The church is set behind a graceful facade with five arches. It now houses the municipal art museum.

This is in the heart of the historic pedestrian area of the town, the lion fountain is just in front and the Town Hall a few meters away. The art exhibition changes so always something different to see. It is housed in a former basilica.

Good church in a good location.If you are in the area it deserves a visit.I have been and I will go back again.
