Lovely and clean beach.The sea was a bit choppy,but it was October,towards the end,so maybe it was the time of the year. Very quiet,plenty of local people walk their dogs,but never any 'mess' left on there. Fabulous for a relaxing time.

Spent a week at this so called 5 star believe me do yourself a favour spend a bit more and head for Mexico or the Caribbean and experience real 5 star not med 5 star. Compared to the above food,drinks,entertainment and bars wow sorry folks but this was not the 5 star we have

Its quite a windy beach but on a nice day it would be very nice indeed, sun beds are to be paid for as usual but that's not the end of the earth hey. The water was actually warmer than our pool which was a surprise.
Long beach and impressive rocks, where family like to spend time, safely in a beautiful setting, a perfect beach for a long walk while listening to the sound of waves.
The our Elysium hotel located near the sea, in front of the road, next to a nice beach with sunbeds and umbrellas. Also possible to rent a scooter and other water attractions
Analipsi and Anassaris have the best beach along that coast. The sand it not pebbly and its very wide - lovely beach!

A pleasant beach just over the road from the Sensatori hotel. As with all beaches in the area it is owned by the government who let it out to vendors who charge for an umbrella and sunbeds - 5 euros a day for two sunbeds and an umbrella so not too expensive
We enjoyed the beach and swimming here, beautiful clear water. Parts of the beach had rocks but in general it was a safe and good place to swim.
What an outstanding beach even as the Cretan beaches go. Breathtaking in its beauty and splendour.. I must spend more time on this fabulous sandy strip with perfect rolling waves
The beach is very user friendly. The sea can be quite rough but if you walk to the left past the little church you find the "Lagoon" as we called it perfect for snorkelling and infants
Walked by several times. It's a decent sandy beach but not the best we've ever been too. Sadly the surrounding area doesn't make it welcoming at all.

The beach has good facilities, showers, changing areas, lifeguards in the peak season, plenty of beds and umbrellas at reasonable prices.... Many swimmers enjoyed the waves on windy days and the water is safe and shallow for quite a distance in.
I do not understand how one can call it a beach ok ... strip of sand that never sees rake for cleaning
Didn't bathe here but cycled through, it looked great and was on the to do list, but time ran out, (so much to do and see in Crete). You could spend a day here, lots of Taverna's and shop's.

Used beach as hotel was too cosy around pools, rented 2 beds and parasol for 5 Euros which was quite good as they were fairly new. Water was too rough to go in sea eg redflag all week which strictly adhered to by lifeguards. Sand is a bit like old building site with a far amount

This is a long beach and we used the Tritonas end which is quiet. It has loungers and parasols for €5 a day and the super Tritonas Taverna right by the beach. They are happy for beach users to use their toilets. The sea has a line of a stones/rocks which have to be crossed
Gentle sandy beach - very picturesque - really calm here and a lovely walk morning or evenings - no gimmicks
The beach is very long, lots of space, a bit stony in places so pick your spot, especially for Swimming, lovely waves especially later in the day.

Quite shallow approx 100cm for quite a way out. Only a small lifeguarded area. A little bit wavey when we were there for small kids. bit of a reef to snorkel on, not big enough waves for body boarding.

Beach is nice enough albeit quite narrow but the problem is the sea is quite volatile. Whatever you do, take the flags seriously. My teenage daughter was pulled under the rope by the waves and mum broke a toe on rocks dragging her back! It was calf deep only after that scare.
Excellent beach. A bit rocky in places but one of the best in Crete. Waves wre a bit choppy on the day we visited. But life guards on duty and very helpful.
A common place to enjoy the sun and sea, but not a wow place to visit for a 2nd time. We spent there max 3 hours
relaxing and comfortable beach with everything you need right next to you from restaurants, bars, supermarkets ect...
Nice and clean, water in Sept was surprisingly warm. We walked about 30 mins away from the town and then back again, and it's a well used path for joggers and walkers.
This isn't a very nice beach I've seen better,although we never sunbathed here there was a few people on the beach and in the sea the sea was quite rough some days and the red flags were flying

its a nice beach which is very quite and I didnt see a lot of people there, many local go there on foot. one thing I can recommend there to do is the Air Extreme which is 10 minutes of extreme and fun!

Not very safe for children, its pebbles but also there are rocks where a child could fall and crack their head on the rocks. However, if you're a fisherman, then take your rod there were plenty of locals doing their fishing there!
Lovely beach but not enough sunbeds. Only a couple of mins walk from the hotel and close enough to get a drink and use WC

Nice beach, shallow waters, fine golden sand. You can go to captains beach, rwnt two sun beds and 1 umbrella for 6 e/day. Free WiFi that actually works :-). The only downside if this beach... in the water there are rocks... so dificult to.swin/bathe without water slippers.
The beach is a little stony, but there are so many sun chairs to relax on.. the scenery is breath taking.. the people are friendly and helpful.

A five star hotel that does have its own private beach and where you have to pay for the sunbeds and umbrellas. Also an all inclusive hotel where there are no facilities offered on the beach so we had to go back across the road and into the hotel for water and snacks.

Beautiful sandy beach, but there are some rocks in the water, so you have to watch where you step. There were quite big waves and windy when we were there, but we liked it because otherwise there would be too hot:) Depends in what hotel you are, there are sunbeds and umbrellas

Beach itself is average, some rocky parts and some sandy stretches. However not crowded at all so it really feels at times like you have the place to yourself. Lovely to walk along the small cliffs as well.
The beach was beautiful and clean few rocks in sea but you could see all fish swimming a round sun beds for hire which you could keep all day
google: Nice beach, unfortunately, too much sharp rocks around...

Very good beach.
However there are a lot of sharp rocks in the water. When the sea is calm you can see the rocks in the water and avoid them however when there are waves the rocks are not visible and they are dangerous as you can get hurt. …
Largest beach I've ever seen. The sea has some really big waves which can be very fun. Restaurants here also deliver quality food, very enjoyable.

trip: This is only a small pebbly beach with sunbeds but was perfect in October. I can imagine it would be very busy in the summer though. There are a couple of supermarkets and a couple of Tavernas too.

Only 5 minutes down the steep hill from our hotel Blue Bay resort. Water was so clear that you could see the fishes swimming around your feet. Be careful as first part is mostly gravel then a bit of sand but a very slippery rock surface before you can start swimming. Taverns
Wonderful for snorkeling! Lovely pebbly beach with two family tavernas offering delicious sea food and mini markets covering all your needs from food to beauty products to sea side essentials.
A much nicer beach that the one at Agia Pelagia. Some room to lay a towel if you don't want to hire a sunbed. Clear water, and easy to walk into the sea. Tavernas and shops close by.

We stayed at the Blue bay Resort Hotel which is just up the road from the beach. The beach is quite corse with regards sand however the sea is quite shallow from the beach allowing paddling and swimming further out. The tavernas and shops are well placed with scuba diving from
Much nicer than the main busy beach....hire a quad so u can get from beach to beach....plus all the off reading fun along the way
Lovely small beach with shops and bars. This beach is quiet due to its location with sun loungers available.

This is a lovely beach with a steep hill down to it. There are a few Tevernas and shops right at the beach which serve fab food and cocktails!! Particularly beautiful at sunset! Great place for snorkelling as their are plenty of fish. Stay Wet scuba diving are located here and

Nice, little beach in between Sea Side hotel and another one, facilities to rent sun-beds and umbrellas with small shops and places to eat, there is everything you need. The sea is lovely and I would recommend this beach.

A chance hookup with the parents of our son's school friends ends up in the discovery of this lesser known beach. Situated in an isolated cover, the beach has great facilities and tavernas etc surrounding it. It's a good spot for kids as well. Short version, its a place you want

This tiny bay is peaceful and beautiful. Despite the tourists, it is still romantic and traditional. There is an atm right on the beach, a couple of shops selling beachwear and souvenirs, bar and taverna too... You must pay 2 euros for each lounger you rent and 3 for umbrella.

We visited this most days, it is 7 euros for a parasol and 2 beds on the beach or throw your towel down for free. We drank and ate in Nemos Bar, great lads there. The entry to the water is a flat rock that can be slippy but you can buy the beach shoes for 6 euros that stop you
We were staying at the Sea side Resort and this was the nearest beach. Sea is clear and fantastic for swimming and snorkelling. It is very stony so wear beach shoes but no complaints from us !!

This place is 30 min drive from Heraclion airport, I find it very convenient. The entrance into the sea is stony, so it's better to have special shoes. If you like - just a 5 min walk from this beach there is Psaromoura beach, where you can swim without shoes. There are several
Nice and quiet sunbeds reasonable price but you need beach shoes due to rocks which are very slippery
Quiet and very relaxing. Couple of restaurants and shops. Lovely beach. Sun loungers 3.50 euros per day.

We walked to several beaches from Agia Pelagia and stopped for lunch at Vasilis. It was a fantastic experience. Family run restaurant with incredible service, genuine hospitality. Prices were extremely reasonable. Lots of extras included,appetizers, fruit, dessert and raki.
Visited the beach every day, very stony but great for snorkelling, you could swim out and stand on the rocks making you look like you were standing on the water! Stelios Taverna is lovely
This isn't a sandy beach and it's quite small. However, the water is crystal clear and the snorkeling is fantastic. Sea shoes recommended.
This beach is reached by going through the hotel at the end of town . We got there about 12 and there were so many people we couldn't even see the beach . Far too small and crowded.
Peaceful, laid-back beach (in October), without excessive commercialisation. Nemo bar and Stelios Tavern recommended.

This cute beach on the north coast is just perfect! Facing eastward and surrounded by headlands, it is protected from the prevailing winds. In all the days we were there (when the sea was pretty choppy and unswimmable on the other beaches north and south of Crete), the water
Lovely shingle beach, lovely clear water for swimming in and great for snorkelling, beach shoes recommended, plenty of sun loungers & umbrellas, we preferred to just lay on the beach.

We visited the beach a couple of times for a swim in the warm waters whilst staying at Seaside Resort. The beach is small but pleasant. You can pay around €5 for a sunbed and parasol but we only wanted a swim so didn't bother.Is worth buying some snorkel gear as there are plenty

Staying at blue bay resort this beach was a 10 minute walk away, really nice shops and restruants on the beach front. The sunbeds are $2 and umbrella $3, which I thought was excess considering I didn't ask for the umbrella and you can't move it , so there's no choice but to sit
Little gem of a beach if you are looking for somewhere off the beaten track. There’s a couple of supermarkets and taverna’s.

Quite a narrow beach but with nice facilities along the front of the village, taverna's bars, shops, diving centre etc. Pebbly beach but the stones are small so easy to walk and nice to lie on. Sea is clear and nice for snorkeling.

This is a small beach at the bottom of a very steep walk but is a little gem. It is in the middle of a few friendly shops and bars but can be busy on a beautiful day so be there early if you want a lounger.

Visited this beach regularly during our stay at the Blue bay Hotel, as it was only a really short walk to the beach. We quite liked it, it is a little small but never was crowded when we visited. Pebble beach and as you enter the beautiful water you will be absorbed, literally,

Relatively small beach, calm or wavy depending on wind direction, many umbrellas & sunbeds (for those who want them), easy to get to & so-so to park if by car, steep climb back up if on foot or bicycle. Coffee or drinks at Yorgo's "Nemo" (far right looking to the beach from the
Small beach with some local eateries and souvenir shops and supermarket. Access quite steep and not very sandy. Limited space due to small size.
Great place to snorkel and have a peaceful afternoon. Few shops and some lovely bars and restaurants.

By far the best in the area, Mononaftis has the best tavernas, less people, and feels leess developed (although there are an excess of sunbeds, umbrellas , concrete and humans on the beach) More windy that the more crowded Agia PElagia beaches but tolerable. Nice beach but not

Plenty of beds and parasols available - a man will collect money for use. Snorkelling here is amazing, but sea shoes are a must owing to the pebbles and slippery rocks. Nearby Vasilis taverna is definitely worth a visit too.

Lovely little beach with a few shops and tavernas ideal beach for diving there are sunbeds and umbrellas for hire, the only problem is the hill ok coming down but a bit steep getting back up especially in hot weather ,the hotel at the top puts on a little bus but they are few
Rather small but really stunning. Clear waters, great for snorkeling in - plenty of fish and crabs to see. Bring beach shoes though as it's very stony.

Beach looks nicely maintained and is good to sunbathe, but if you come from a warm place (Miami) you will find it lacking. There is a Scuba school and it seems well run and safe. Saw a group of eight go out with three instructors. Plus: There is a great tavern (Stelios) here,
Although this beach is a stony beach it is really nice and friendly. it is in a lovely cove , brilliant restaurants and a couple of good supermarkets. Romantic setting
best beatch so far! no sand in your pants, clear sea just perfect! nice bar 2 good restaurants,2 mini markets

Nice beach BUT difficult to Swim or bath because you Cant go in without fall,its all a big stone instead of sand or small Stones ,but the best fish tavern Stelios is here so IF you want to eat,tou must visit this beach
This is a cracking little beach surrounded by pretty hills and excellent Tavernas. Sheltered and well cleaned, a perfect setting for a relaxed day on the beach.

Nice beach to relax and wind down the hours, not a big beach and i guess during peak months can get very busy, only a handful of shops and restaurants but the one we visited was very nice with a great selection of cocktails drinks and food.

Considering its vicinity with five star resorts, one might think this beach can be as well a place to display the latest luxury brand sundresses :) - but it's not. It's actually hardly set up at all, with modest sun chairs you can rent, a dressing hut and a lukewarm fresh water

This is a cute little quiet beach, a few shops, and some bars and tavernas. I've reviewed the Taverna Stelios which is on this beach, so great food and drink can be found in this little slice of paradise that is hidden away. Great swimming, water very clear and tucked away in
Lovely beach so close to hotel really friendly everything you need there it's safe and clean awesome snorkelling there too
Small but quaint beech plenty of sun beds to hire it is a small bay and the sea is warm in september
Small and enclosed on all sides by cliffs and buildings. Seems old and retro so don't expect modern surroundings but if you want to relax, this is the place.

Beautiful beach - well maintained with a life guard - it was great watching the hustle and bustle on the beach with the diving school, etc and you can walk out quite far - it is quite difficult to get in due to rocks etc
A small local beach, a bit stoney but pleasant enough for a few hours. Some good shops and bars, worth a good look around.

Water is clean and good for swimming and diving. There is a bar and a shop near by. Be sure to bring your own sun umbrella, otherwise it can be very hot in the open sun. It is best if you come to the beach around 8 in the morning.
Stopped off for a quick drink during a walk, the beach was empty and the tide was coming in so we didn't stick around. Barman was pleasant. No toilet facilities and a step hill down into the beach.

This is a lovely little beach to spend a day at and something I would definitely recommend if your hotel is nearby. It is a fairly small beach and a little rocky, but apart from those drawbacks it is amazing!
Beach not sand and down a very steep hill from our hotel (Blue Bay). A few souvenir shops, bar and restaurant.
Lovely little beach with friendly bars and restraunts and couple of shops. Care hire place here is very reasonable and family business. It's a bit rocky but smirking is great

We enjoyed our trip to the beach it is small and gets busy early. Sun beds are available to hire. Very pebbly underfoot so swim shoes may be a good idea. But beautiful clear, calm water once you are in. Some fish about if you enjoy snorkelling. A couple of shops and tavernas

Nice quiet pebbly beach with clear water within walking distance of the town. It can get a bit full but doesn't feel overcrowded. There is one beach bar for drinks and ice creams. If you get a spot close to the cliff face you will be protected from the sun in the later

This beach is beautiful, however it was painful for me to walk around on this beach. The stones really hurt your feet. Myself, my daughter and her friend we all got cuts on our feet and knees from going in the sea. You would be walking and there would be massive rocks under the
Brilliant beach,always great and clean and the staff that run it are always on point and nothing is ever an issue if you ask for it. Miss it greatly.

Another excellent swimming spot that is a bay and therefore protected from high winds and waves which you often get in July and August on the northern shores of Crete. Some geological plates at the beginning make access a bit tricky but once you are in the swimming and
Beautiful beach, great views, great shower - just too stoney for me. You need shoes to walk on the beach - tricky with bare feet!
Nice if staying close by.few waves and pebble beach. Next to sea side resort. We spent several hours soaking here.
Terrible beach, very dangerous for children. The rocks are all over the beach. Impossible to enter to sea without special shoes.
Lovely bay but not sand it's mostly stone and clay in the water need shoes on or you slip, sunbeds and umbrellas there two sunbeds and umbrella 7 euro for the day.
Small but well worth a visit...great tavernas. This beach is towards the far edge of Agia Pelegia and we only found it cos we hired a quad.

You will need beach shoes but the swimming is amazing. Lots of people snorkelling and diving classes taking place. Couple of tavernas...Stelios taverns is amazing , great service and food and given fruit and ice-cream for free
We visited this Beach while on our recent holiday, There were plenty of beds if you get there early, it can get very busy after 11am, great facilities nearby too.
Headed to this beach most days, lay on the sunbeds for a good few hours, just the right amount of beds there too.
All the staff in Stelios Family taverna very friendly and attentive. Great strawberry daquiris! Speed boat hire team great as well.
Lovely beach. Pepples but beautiful clear water. Sun beds for a fee plus parasol. Lovely tavernas especially Vasillis.

I had a very pleasant stay in this hotel. This place is beautiful and all the staff os very kind and helpful and also the general manager. We had also very good meals. The quality and variety of the food was perfect. I highly recommend this hotel. And i hope to come back.

A beautiful little beach, only a few minutes down the hill from the Seaside resort where we were staying. It's a shingle beach and the rocks get very hot so would recommend getting some swimming shoes! The water is crystal clear and great for snorkelling - you can buy all the

Went for a week early June, beach was a 300m walk from our hotel, (The Seaside Resort), down a small cliff side path. Beach is a small shingle affair, maybe 200m wide. Water crystal clear, and had some slippery flat rock on the seabed as you walked into the sea. This beach was

this is a pebbaly beach which i would reccomend reef shoes to walk on, sun loungers are available and there are a couple of shops and tavernas, this is a good beach from which to go diving and also has crystal clear water visibility 25-40 meters
This was a local beach part of an area a bit remote but well worth a visit but wear comfortable shows as a walk down hill and steep on the return
Lovely beach and bay. Great for snorkelling with food and drink readily available from Taverna Bar Vasilis. We spent most of our time here - much better than the hotel pool!
The beach is small but has everything you need. You can rent sun loungers and brollies and the water is very clear
Sellios Taverna superb. Extensive but very reasonably priced menu. All fresh and cooked to order. With a great freindly welcome and hospitality received throughout the meal.

This is a lovely tiny beach. We went in May at the start of the season but we didn't have to fight for space on the beach though. The beach has 3 bars and 3 shops and it was quaint. On there is Stelios restaurant which I would highly recommend to anyone. If I'm being mega
Really nice clean beach Worth the short trip from the village I would happily spend several sun soaked days here
It's a small beach with crystal clear waters but I dislike the fact that the beach was small and we haven't enough room to enjoy the sand
This beach is stunning! I would recommend this to anyone, gorgeous water, golden sand, great little shops and cafes surrounding it. A huge step up from all surrounding beaches in the area too!
A lovely beach with glorious views round 2 headlands. Small but lovely. Particularly beautiful at night.
lovely little shingle beach , taverns and shops , massive hill if walking down and up. thats pretty much it...

TAKE WET SHOES AND SNORKELS!! This beach is beautiful, one your in the sea, it is rocky and the rocks are slippery. You can buy wet shoes from the shops on the beach and they were about €6/7 the water is clear and lots of little fishes to see! Not suitable for little children or

Very intimate athmosphere at this small beach a little bit west of Agia Palagia village. With the sea viewa and the mountains around, this is a beach where you can totally relax and enjoy wonderful swimming in the soft and warm Mediteranean ocean. Just behind you there is a
Spent a couple of days here on our 1 week holiday. Pebble Beach, nice atmosphere , couple of nice tavernas and supermarkets. Gorgeous water to cool off in, what more can you ask.

Fabulous little beach, fine pebbles, but OK, sunbeds and umbrellas 2 euro each per day. 3 litle bars and eating places, 2 supermarkets, 2 souvenir shops and a car hire/trip shop, along with a dive centre all in one beautiful little bay. Lovel clearn clean water, although the
This beach is much smaller than Agia Pelagia but has a couple of tavernas to get lunch or just a snack. Sunbeds are so cheap only 2 euros.
Lively clean beach but rocky so take swimming shoes and you will love it. Couple of shops and car hire and restraunts

The good news...the beach is relaxing and scenic .... Clear water ...$6 Eros for 2 beach chairs and umbrella ....Now the not so good news ...This beach if you are used to the Caribbean beaches will be a disappointment...beach is small pebbles ....commercialized....peak season
This is a nice beach, perfect to teach kids to snorkel. A few bars and shops for a break. I don't want to write 100 letters, only this.

Lovely clear sea for snorkelling,beach is pebble. A few shops and bars here and sun beds to hire. Only downside is the VERY steep hill going back up! We were staying at Blue Bay Hotel so got the hotel bus back up! Nice place for a day out.
Wear water shoes....there is no sand and the rocks on the floor in the sea are slippery ! The surrounding Supermarkets are really good. Few Euro for bed and parasol.

This beach is a nightmare as it's access is down a very, very steep road with no path but plenty of cars & mopeds. The beach itself is pebbly and hard to walk on. The sea is crystal green and blue and full of rocks. YOU MUST HAVE WET SHOES! The shops by the beach sell them for

We used this beach whilst waiting for our diving adventure, the setting is beautiful with excellent views and it is in a sheltered Cove. Parking is limited and depending where you're staying on crete it may be difficult to find and get to, don't think any public transport goes
This beach is very small but a little gem. The beach is stoney but the sea is beautifully clear. Ideal for swimming and snorkeling. There are some nice bars and shops to also visit.

Love it here! The water is crystal clear and very clean! There is a big rock and once you step off the water is deep. You can swim with fishes, literally! They are not huge, but it is fun! Great for snorkeling and they do have some water sports. There are a lot of cafés and a

We stumbled on this beach, bought shoes to go in the sea as there's no real sand to speak of (although this isn't an issue at all) and snorkels for the four of us. We had the best time, what a great way to spend a day. Quite brilliant!
Looked on the beach from the nearby bars and shops - stony beach with access to sun loungers for a small fee. Very cute little beach and busy everyday well in the evenings when we were there.
Beautiful little beach and cove round it great for swimming in and had local diving club there also great fun would go again my son loved it and the wife also as she doesn't really like the beach

We stayed in the nearby Peninsula Hotel and wondered to find a sandy beach nearby. It looks beautiful with the clear blue waters but unfortunately, we had a bad experience with the slippery rocks and pebbles underneath. The rocks were slippery with algae and very sharp in some
Rocky but crystal clear waters if it is not windy it is worth visiting. Two tavernas and small stores on the beach. cost 2 euro per sunbed and umbrella

It's a lovely shingle beach, there is no doubt about that, reasonable to pay €2 for each bed and umbrella. Great for snorkelling. Just very, very busy, you feel like you're on top of one another. Perhaps if we ever return out of season and not July I would feel differently.

This beach is a small shingle beach where you are able to rent parasols and sun loungers for €2 each item. The sea there is very difficult to swim in,as there are so many slippery rocks and so many people take a tumble whilst trying to walk out to swim. There are no water sports
Lovely beach for snorkelling. Stoney beach and can get a bit crowded but has showers and a taverna and small supermarket.
It is hard to get into the water because of the rocky bottom of the beach. Bring a water shoes to avoid injury. Shops and small resturants are presented. Clear water and almost no waves.

Bit of a hike back up the hill but I think is worth it 100%! Cute little beach which is really peaceful and relaxing. All you need shops wise are there so you don't need to walk far. Defiantly recommend this beach for a morning or afternoon.
Very nice beach, especially for snorkeling - fishes, rocks - beautiful scenery. If you have beach shoes - then it is even more pleasant.

Lovely peacefull beach with pebbles if you don't like sand it is a good beach for you! Lots of places to eat and drink while your there. My kids don't like sand so enjoyed filling there buckets up with pebbles and throwing them into the water. 2€ per sunbed and 2€ per umbrella.
it was great place and the sea was so clear. I just couldn't resist to go out of that. My daughter enjoyed as well. For sure to come back.

We were staying at the nearby Seaside Resort and were able to walk down to the beach. The beach is enclosed by a picturesque bay which provides shelter. The beach is coarse sand/shingle leading to a rocky bed into the sea. Sunbeds and umbrellas are available for hire. The water
Loved this beach, only downside was that the pebbles underwater were a bit on the slippery side which made it a little hard to enjoy, however, I am an ameture swimmer.
Lovely bar and a small shop water like crystal great to get away from our hotel and get a good drink and cocktail.
Lovely little bay. Quaint little local shops that sell almost anything a tourist could need. Only problem for us was that it was a rough pebble beach rather than a sand beach. Lovely none the less

A nice escape for a few hours from our all inclusive package at Blue Bay. A very steep walk down and back. There are a couple of bars and supermarkets and it was nice to have a proper lager! The beach itself is small and pebbly with a ledge down to the water, which are very
Peaceful tranquil beach with beautiful views and beach bars / shops Sun loungers and parasols available for small charge Beach shoes recommend for sea

Pebbled beach, coarse sand, clear waters, - 24 km from Heraklion and very close of Agia Pelagia main beach. It gets its name from the sinking of a ship years back ….just a sailor saved, and in Greek the word 'mononaftis' means….one sailor! It is protected from winds thus it

Pebbled beach, coarse sand, - 24 km from Heraklion and very close of Agia Pelagia main beach. It gets its name from the sinking of a ship years back ….just a sailor saved, and in Greeks this is what it means….one sailor! It is protected from winds thus it is quite popular.
Pebbly, take water shoes, clear clean water and small bar. Near 2 large resort hotels but not directly overlooked by them and sun nearly all,day.

Stayed at the chc seaside resort and spa, went to the beach with my daughter which is lovely not quite sand but still lovely. Visited a few shops on the beach all lovely, however I bought a few things from the supermarket next to stellios, I changed my mind just as I was

Sitting between two large hotels is the cosy Mononaftis Beach. Stony sand and pebbles with a rocky start to the sea gives way to the warm waters of the sea. Quite a relaxed beach with two kiosks nearby and two pleasant tavernas for a snack. A great break from the nearby hotel.

Set in a small cove at the end of a winding road with great views on the descent. Beautiful clear and clean water. A great swim. There is also a dive centre if you want to learn to scuba! 3or4 tavernas face the sea .Vasilis is very good and very friendly. The beach was not too
Quite beach with fisherman and little boats but the water is crystal clear.Just like a greek beach should be <3

Lovely clean warm water, little fishes, lots of good places on the beach to eat and drink. Beech is very narrow so I can imagine it a bit crowded during high season, however, I really enjoyed it in Oct as it was very quiet. Hire of sun loungers cheap.
beautiful Crystal clear waters plenty of sunbeds on the door step of places to eat and only a short walk from hotels

This is a small, relatively narrow pebble beach with cristal clear water and stunningly great diversity of fish to see. In the october there is enough place for visitors, even on the most sunny and warm days. The sunbeds and umbrellas were at that time for free. There are two

Staying at seaside hotel and came down a couple of times. 5m wide sand and shingle beach with several pleasant tavernas and a supermarket and gift shops. Good for snorkeling but you'll need sea shoes as once in water there's lots of slippy slabs of rock.

this cosy little beach at the bottom of the hill from the blue bay hotel is a real sun trap serviced by 2 supermarkets and 2 bars and a couple of local tat shops a car hire place a diving school so it had everything you could want for. a tip i would pass on is it is quite rocky
Really nice little beach the sea is so clear few rocks so be careful take some beach shoes with you there few nice little shops and bars on the beach
Very nice beach!!!! Beautiful sea !organist beach!Very nice tavernas!!!!Diving centrer!!!!!For strong experience!!!!Its Lovely!!!!!
Beautifull small bay with very clear water. We spend few adsolutely relaxing days here. Recomended to escape from the pool...
