If you want to see the miracles a great ancient civilization can create you must visit the Historical museum of Crete. A unique experience that you will remember for the rest of your life.
Please go there to watch and admire a great ancient civilization, the Minoan one. Wonderful pieces of art magnificently displayed. You will not regret your visit.

The museum was straightforward and easy to understand. It was also winter time during our visit, so the tickets were half-priced. We walked through the museum without a guide, and it was manageable. The rooms are labeled and a suggested route is plotted out, so you just have

This is a wonderful museum showcasing the finds from the Minoan Civilisation in Crete. Dating from early times onwards the main focus is 2000 - 1200 BCE. There are statues, pottery, flints and much more. The colourful wall paintings are stunning. You can spend 1,2, 3 or even 4

We greatly enjoyed this superb museum. Having visited three Minoan sites it was so rewarding to see so many treasured artefacts clearly displayed. There was an excellent introduction to each section and good descriptions in English by the artefacts. The Minoan civilisation was
This is an incredible collection of artefacts and a must see if visiting the area. Not expensive and easy place to find. Close to the centre of town so easy walking distance.
We visited the Heraklion Archeological Museum last September. Place is awsome! Very nice and organised!

Great overview of the major historical artefacts around Crete and giving the back story on the island and its history. While this attraction is by no means cheap, if you enjoy museums you will find this attraction a must see. I would say the quality of the exhibits are on par

Such a great museum. I really appreciated the phaestus disc. So cool and interesting to read about. The museum takes a long time so come prepared. We did it at night and loved it. Not many people and cooler temps. Highly recommended. Our favorite thing besides going to Knossos.

The museum is perfect: modern, full of information, clean, well illuminated. Today it was half price so I even got a great bargain at five euros. I strongly suggest it to anyone, more than Knossos. I stayed inside two hours...
Very well presented, with good explanations. Not too many people and the area of this city is worth being visited as well A few parkings outside
Good Museum, lots to see and well displayed, visited just on a day visits as part of a cruise party. Would've been good to have more time to look at the artefacts in more depth.
Everything you ever wanted to know about the Minoan civilisation. Unbeatable. Later Greek and Roman period, also good. Down side is that it can be a bit hard for kids, as it is not interactive.

If you go to only one museum on Crete, make it this one, and plan to spend at least 3 hours, or better, go 2 days in a row. Great collection, well displayed. Only downside is that they close at 3, as do other museums in Heraklion.

This Museum was wonderful. However, if you buy the ‘3 day combo ticket with Knossos Palace’ you can only visit each place once. When we went to the Museum the entire 1st floor was closed. We were told that we couldn’t come back the next day. Eventually, the ticket seller did

Exceptional and exciting place! The beginnings of European civilization, but also of the visible influences of other civilizations of the Middle East! Each exhibit leaves a deep impression. Artistic expression, craftsmanship, beauty of these objects fascinates you. It was worth
A museum well worth visiting. The range and quality of the artefacts is truly stunning. Recommend giving yourselves plenty of time or even making two visits to take it all in!

After extensive renovation, the museum finally has the facilities needed to house such a wide and important array of exhibits hailing mainly from the Minoan civilization. Only thing I would like to comment is that I didn't find an easily accessible map of the ancient cities
Great exhibits of some of the most famous and significant historical arifacts of ancient civilizations. I am glad I can now say I saw these with my own eyes before I die.

I travel a lot and have been to many museums and honestly it is one of the best perhaps the best. Why? the layout of the museum allow for easy follow of history. The artefacts are fantastic. I was amazed at how the Minoan people were such great artisans. Definitely worth the

Heraklion (or more accurately, Heracleon) has an excellent museum, unlike anything you can find on the planet. It houses the best exchibition of Minoan art. The Minoans, at their peak, generated culture that still feels contemporary, and influenced abstract art (Picasso and the

We had just 2 hours. Not enough time! There is so much to see, so much to wonder at, such beauty & ingenuity, so well displayed. We only had time to dip in here & there, and left feeling quite frustrated at how much we missed, as we know we'll never be back. PS be careful not

One of the oldest, largest and most important museums in Greece, and among the most important museums in Europe. The Herakleion Museum is rightly considered as the museum of Minoan culture par excellence worldwide.

This is worth a visit to see the famous frescoes from the palace at Knossos. It is not the best type of museum for kids as not very interactive at all. So if you travel with kids...concentrate on the main things and try to help them engage with the artefacts.
This is fairly new and worth seeing. We were on a cruise and only had a half day in crete so we bought a combo ticket for this s=and knossos palace great value!
Must see it ! Perfect archeological museum and it was good occasion with free entrance on Saturday afternoon
You need to go there. It's a cultural journey that you must be in. It's actually accessible cause it's close to the most know square : the lion square.

An excellent museum, really well curated - taking you through the Minoan, Greek and Roman periods. Definitely recommend visiting here before going to any of the actual archaeological sites around Crete.

Visited this lovely museum before Knosses. Feel it was right way to do it. Bought joint tickets for both venues. Learnt a lot in well laid out museum. Not busy this time of year. Could have stayed longer than the 2 hours we stayed there but, it closes earlier in winter. 4pm.
You can easily spend up to a couple of hours here, very informative and well laid out. Be careful of the times in winter, as it closes at 4pm.

Very informative place, great works of art and archeological foundings. Here You can learn about Cretan (and greek) history, You can almost feel and touch it. Many beautiful subjects from minoan age, i love the FAISTOS, the bull's head and the original pieces of Knossos frescs.

On a short one day visit to Heraklion we visited both the Palace of Knossos and the Archaeological Museum. Doing both complemented each other well. We took a private tour at the Palace but did a self-tour in the museum. The museum was top-notch in its presentation and have

You just cannot go to Crete and fail to visit the Heraklion museum! You will get amazed by the findings, the detailed decorations, the drawings, the coins, and jewelry. I keep wondering what a great civilization that was! No wonder why Minoans had no enemies and their
We had a short visit unfortunately, but the collection, pieces as well as the organisation, but the staff is awfully rude, which quite spoil the visit... I advise to have at least 2hours ahead.

It is a must! We only had a half day, and I could have easily spent an entire day in there and wish I were closer so I could go back. The restaurant was not open, so I can't comment on it, but there are a lot of places to eat in the vicinity.

We went to the museum on the first Sunday of the month (Free admission). Even with the large crowds the staff kept everything flowing smoothly. Pictures are allowed (no flash). They have a lot of items from pre historic (11 century BC and earlier) times and a wonderful display
Well worth a visit shows so much of the history of Crete makes it easier to understand even if you are not a history fan.

Not at all impressive externally but surprisingly good museum inside! What you are left with is the story of the inevitable rise and fall of the Minoan civilization, from the start in the Bronze Age, through Iron Age, it’s peak and decline.. except it lasted over 1,500 years!

2 floors of stuff, the main things of interest are the Minoan-era items prior to the Hellenic era. Very interesting 'Kamares ware' pottery style I've never seen before. Also the fresco styles are unique, somewhat Egyptian-influenced. I didnt know bull-jumping was a sport!

We spent the day at this amazing museum. There are so so many wonderful exhibits to see here you really need time to take everything in. I thought the bathtub exhibit was the most amazing. It’s absolutely beautiful to be able to see all of the things that are in this museum. It
Excellent museum, showing artefacts from Knossos and other Minoan sites. Exhibits set out in a very organized way with plenty of light and space. It certainly enhanced our visit to Knossos.

This is an absolute must-visit location when in Crete. So glad we took time to see it after our visit to Knossos, it gave a much much better perspective of the Minoan civilization. Very impressive collection of artefacts, all real and authentic (not reconstructed as in Knossos),

We were on a short holiday in Crete and decided that we would like to take a day trip to Heraklion and the Palace of Knossos, We found a tour by Sparrow Travel, which suited us as it picked us up and dropped us off near to our hotel. We paid a combined ticket for the

Really enjoyed our visit after seeing Knossos, brought home the importance of the dig with some really interesting art & jewellery. All displays in French, English, German, Greek & Russian. No queuing lots of Information.
First visit to this Museum. We went on an organised tour from Rethymno with Klados. The tour guide was very knowledgeable and my niece listened intently and found the whole experience wonderful.

The exterior of the building can in no way prepare you for the amazing inside of this spacious museum, which in my opinion is easily one of the top 3 Greek museums. It will take some time to explore but it's the ABSOLUTE MUST when you visit Heraklion!
A must when in Heraklion. The exhibits of one of the most ancient civilisations in the world are spectacular. Don't miss the Phestos discus. Great renovation work.
Easy going museum in the center of Heraklion. Well laid out and interesting without being boring. Highly recommend.
This is a mst if you like history. Very well displayd, although they could work a liitle with the lights. Generous photo policy. Good explanations. Not to be missed if you are interested in history.

After visited Knosos that lacks good and scientific explanations, we also visited Archeological museum, which was great and to me it seemed like everything makes much more sense. There are two floors + usually one extra, smaller exhibition. Btw: there are some dates when they

If you like artifacts and history this place is for you. Very interesting to see how the civilization developed on Crete. I didn’t have time to go to the actual site, but felt like this gave me a good feel for the development of the early civilizations and their beliefs. Highly

One of the best archaeological museums although it doesn't have the size of the British Museum or Louvre. Every object shown is absolutely unique and notable for understanding of the importance of Crete civilization at the time of Minoans.

Spent the day touring the palace of Knossos and also this museum. They really go hand in hand as most of the artifacts here come from Knossos. I would actually stop here first if you have a choice and if you can get a good tour guide it is a major plus. Mostly pottery and

I went on a Sunday after going to the Palace of Knossos. I ended up being free entry. The courtyard was beautiful: columns, shaded with trees and lots of places to sit. A great place to sit and chill out before or after a visit to the museum. You do have to go through a little

Excellent museum, showing artefacts from Knossos and other Minoan sites. Allow two hours or more if you want to rest between exhibits. See this before going to Knossos. There is a combined ticket for both, and if you are over 65, hold and bring an EU passport with you, it's
We went all they way from Sissi to see this museum but unfortunately it was closed as the staff were on strike!
Nicely laid out and presented -top quality museum - well worth a visit! It’s a good 1-2 hour visit. Highly recommended

After visiting Knossos I wanted to see some of the frescos and other original remains The place is very well organized and is full of interesting excavations It has English explanations and you can take pictures of most items There was no guide or audio guide options which

We visited with are 6 month old and used a stroller inside. The Museum has lots to look at and the combo ticket with the archeological site does not cost much more. We first went to the museum and then the site but I would do it the other way around on the next visit.

Do not miss this museum if you go to Heraklion!! Everything is well-thought-out and you move through the museum in chronological order, which helps you to build on what you learn and do so progressively. Took 2 hours to go through all the rooms (2 floors); I took lots of pics.

An incredible wealth of artifacts and information about the past. One could spend much more than 2-3 hours here, but I found that 3 hours was the maximum amount of time before I was so exhausted that i couldn't take in any more (and I did not read every sign or look closely at
Everything Minoan you can think of. Spent about three hours here. Well organized and presented artifacts.

I have never seen anything like these artifacts. So much history and so much truth. We rented a car and saw CRETE. It was an unbelievably Amazing trip. If you visit Greece please island hop and make sure to stop by Crete and see this BEAUTIFUL island full of history and
It was totally one of the best museums I have visited. Really organized and all of its exhibits were stunning!

The exhibits are well done and displayed many artifacts. We learned a lot from the descriptions. We appreciated the free stroller to use for our baby and there is a coat check as well. The garden area outside the museum is peaceful. It was nice that the museum stayed open until

A story well told and explained of the life of human of Crete, through its objects of everyday life, art and other artifacts, with details that are worth to know. I also enjoyed very much the discovery of their civilizations, their moments, their religion, and much more.

The museum holds most of the great finds from the early civilisation on Crete. Wonderful. Early jewellery is exquisite and early writing v important as well as huge pots and tiny statues of female deities. Really valuable to go before Knossos and Malia etc. Get an idea of the

Interesting artifacts to view. You can take pictures in some areas of the museum. There are good descriptions in each area to identify what you are looking at. Also, there are museum personnel in each room who can assist with questions. If you are going to visit the Palace or
Don't leave Heraklion without seeing this incredible museum, which opened up a new world of old history for me.
Visited this museum on a recent trip to Heraklion would recommend highly. It is well laid out and extremely informative and needs at least 3/4 hours to get the best out of it. Well worth a visit.

What could I say: incredible museum, a must-do in a trip to Crete to learn the history and events that made this island. But most of all, to understand how small we are thinking to our technology comparing with what they were able to do at that time with nothing. I don't know
A very interesting and modern Museum with lots of exhibits from Cretan history. Good facilities toilets, restaurant etc,

The artifacts on display are very impressive and give an excellent record of (particularly) the Minoan history and culture. The downside for me was the the lack of explanation of the 'bigger picture'. A bit more effort explaining the context in which these artifacts were found

This museums contains a collection of all things Minoan such as jewellery, pottery, seals, art, etc, as well as some original frescos from arechelogical sites. Considering the age of the Minoan culture the displayed objects are really impressive and give an idea how advanced the
Easy to spend at least half a day here - even if you are not a history buff, just appreciate the design and art! Easy to access from Bus Station A from anywhere along north coast resorts.
Amazing artifacts from the Minoan age. Well worth a visit, preferably after a tour to Knossos Palace with a tour because everything will have more meaning.
This museum has been so improved. There is now aircon. The exhibits are well lit. There are intelligent display boards. It is great
Amazing place to visit, it was very easy to get there by bus. They have a great service. You can get anywhere by bus, just check the schedule where do you want to go. And be on time.
Has most of the finds from classical Knossos. The original murals are here although reconstructions can be seen at the site. Some prepalatial and Roman era finds too.

I'm not usually a museum person, I'll admit, but my friend convinced me to visit the Archaeological Museum with her and I'm honestly glad I did. If you go to the Palace of Knossos before, for one Euro more, you can also include a ticket to the Museum, so it's worth it to check

His museum is a must see attraction. Even if you are a clueless fool who loves only celebrity culture you should come here just to see how little we have developed in 5000 years. The museum is stuffed full of magnificent artefacts from the Minoan culture, many of which were

The museum focuses on the Minoan and Roman periods of Crete's history. The Minoan component is particularly well-presented, and is an essential complement to a visit to Knosssos or any other of the Minoan sites in the region. The museum is easily accessible. Tickets to visit

My husband and I just went to the Heraklion Archaeological Museum this afternoon, and were completely impressed with both the size and scope of the collection, and its presentation. The museum begins with the Minoan civilization, that began around 7000 B.C. and ended around 1100

We had a great time exploring the elaborate collection of the museum, they have a lot of beautifull pieces that help you visualise the life in the old civilisations. If you plan on visiting the Knossos palace site within 3 days it’s worth buying the combo ticket, saves you a lot

I you are in Crete even for one day, a visit to an Archaeological museum is a must. The building seems to be newly renovated, spacious halls, amazing artifacts on display with English commentaries. Highly recommended!
The museum is light,airy and spacious and boasts an amazing collection of Minoan artefacts which are displayed well...

16 euros gets you a combined ticket for the museum and knossos which you can spread over 3 days. It's basically full of artefacts from 5000 bc to the Roman period but specialising in the Minoan period up to 1450bc. If you like pots this is for you. Seriously some impressive

This is really one of the best places in the world to see an extensive collection of Minoan art and artefacts. This is now housed in a modern purpose built museum which overlays some historic ruins in the grounds. If you plan to visit Knossos buy a joint entry ticket for
It was one of the best local museum I have visited. Great ancient objects. Very good architectural project and lovely display. You will need at least two hours.
Just when you think that you can't learn anymore about Ancient Greece or be overwhelmed with ancient artefacts you visit the Heraklion Archaeological Museum and you're still blown away!!!

More than 4.500 years of history till today very interesting!!! The staff have to be more friendly and helpful!!! I recommend to everyone who like the history of Crete and not only!!! It's a must to visit..

Visit Knossos first. We had a private guide and she was able to relate the objects to our earlier visit to Knossos. So much to see. Some of the exhibits were spectacular including the jewellery, religious objects and burial baths.
immense quantity of well-presented ancient Minoan artifacts, including the most important from Knossos palace....

The ruins of Knossos near Heraklion are impressive, but they have no museum, you only see footings and the ruins of buildings, many restored in the early 20th century. To truly see Cretan culture - from the earliest times through the Minoan civilisation to the time of the Romans

This is a must visit after the Knossos Archaeological Site.....there is so much to see and so many exhibits are in amazing condition considering their age. Make sure you purchase the combo ticket which gives you entry to both.

Spent about three hours. The artefacts were fabulous and so well preserved! What a civilisation were the Minoans. Exhibits set out in a very organised way with plenty of light and space. A MUST visit!
Oldest stuff I have seen. Mind blowing massive collection of statues, artefacts, ancient writing back to 5 centuries BC. Loved the economics records. Minoans rock!

We visited this museum in October 2018. The collection of rare artifacts is unbelievable. The exhibition is very well organised. Although it was busy with many German groups we could find a chance to approach every showcase we were interested in. One recommendation for tourists

We did things the opposite of the tours. we saw the museum first and then Knossos. We like this better because we feel we can place the items in the museum better when we go the site. This worked out well in this case as their is a scale model in the museum. It is very well laid
Made two trips to the Archaeological Museum - there is a lot to see. It is all very well presented. Can be crowded.

A very well organized display with some world class highlights. The exhibit includes English captions, well lighted. Even the last video/slide exhibit on the history of the Minoan archeological digs and the main players in creating the museum held a lot of interest. It certainly
There is a lot to see. It puts a visit to the ruins of Knossos Palace into context and is very interesting.

If you have been to some of the archeological sites on the island, this gives you a great insight of the arts and crafts. Some of the pots and figurines are so beautiful, it is hard to imagine they have survived for such a long time. Enjoyed it very much!
Incredible iconic artifacts of ancient crete. Amazing stuff. Recommend a tour with Ionna Glyptis to get full and correct context; the wall plaques are useful, but not always complete or accurate.
interesting and very well laid out. with good information for each display, definitely worth a visit.

I'm very glad I visited the museum (which was included in my 8 euro OAP ticket for Knossos. Seeing all the Minoan artefacts enhances the whole Knossos experience. The highlight for me was the Minoan draughts game. But all the pottery and jewelry were also remarkable. I didn't

I believe the museum had just completed a multi year renovation and it is beautiful. You can spend as much or as little time as you would like here depending on how you pace yourself. The collection is vast and beautiful.
Amazing way to complete ones visit of Knossos. Visit in that order. Only negative is the pushy tour groups
Great collection of ancient artefacts. I really liked the amphoras with the animals painted on them! Excellent!

This place is a treasure trove of Ancient Greek artefacts and is a great thing to do after visiting Knosos All the artefacts are displayed in different rooms with signs explaining their importance If you like the ancient world go here!

I absolutely loved this visit; definitely worth a go. Immerse yourself in the local history and culture. Very inspirational early art and crafts on display. A strong sense of centuries of life gone by and local specificity.

For an extra 1 euro we added a visit to this museum to our ticket price at the Knossos site. After spending about 3 hours wandering around Knossos we made the effort to drive into Heraklion and visit the museum where all of the ACTUAL artifacts, including frescoes that were
this museum is a treasure for the world and the humanity Every piece is unique and beautiful is a visit worth

There was so much to see and it was good to be with a Guide who was able to explain the exhibits in more detail . The fact that most of the artefacts were thousands of years old and that some had been painstakingly pieced together was amazing . It was a wonderful place to visit

We enjoyed very much the marvellous artifacts. Exhibitions are pretty well organized. It would have been an interesting visit, if there hadn't been so many noisy groups, all led by screaming guides. What a pity for such an important museum.

The museum itself is beutiful! We didn’t have a guide! And I strongly recomend that, otherwise all you do is looking on clayfigures, statues, tools and so on, without any background! We ordered combined tickets for 16 Euros, because we Will visit Knossos later! A single ticket
This is a very interesting museum with a lot to see and read about. If you are visiting Knossos or going this is the place to see all the artifacts from there.
We only managed the ground floor as time was limited. Interesting museum with lots of Minoan artefacts on display.

Absolutely wonderful museum so much to see & take in will definitely return next time I am in Crete. You could easily spend half a day or more to fully see all of the superb exhibits. Cafe was closed when we got there (quite late on a Saturday afternoon) so can’t comment on
A lot you can see and learn about ancient history of the Crete. Only thing that was missing is , you can't buy book or a catalog about the current or the past exhibitions.
One of the greatest museums in Greece with a huge collection of Minoan Art. Went here on a guided tour after a Knossos visit.
The museum included so many artefacts from Minoan times. It was quite busy while we were there but this did not pose a problem. Toilets could have been cleaner.
So important and so beutiful museum exhibits, everyone must visit this Museum! Infact, you can spend there all the day!

Huge museum. Welcome cool temperatures from the heat of the city. Lots of very interesting exhibits and well laid out. Bags are scanned on the way in and liquid sprays etc (we had a sunscreen in our bag) are kept on entry and returned to you via a cloakroom ticket system as you

Great displays , well thought out and presented . A must for anybody who appreciates history and the achievements of the Minoan civilisation . You could easily spend a couple of hours in the museum . The museum is Airconditioned and well lit .

The place to visit. Great archaeological museum with unbelievable artifacts. Very good organized museum on 2 levels. Excellent presentation. No problem to take photos. Don't forget to visit Knossos palace at the same time.
google: Enjoyable, small local museum. Displays some of the more common tools that were used throughout history. You'll walk through it in 20-30 minutes, but its nice, quiet and cool. Its 0-4 euros p.p, while children enter for free up to 12 years …

A well thought out museum run by lovely helpful staff. A great look back in time at how life was and to see how the home was used. Intuitive information boards let you look up information about the items right infront of you.

This is an excellent museum of rural life and definitely well worth a visit and the staff on duty when we visited exceptional and a credit to the museum and the village. Many thanks to them for making this a wonderful afternoons visit and a lovely memory of our Crete holiday.

Plateia or Platia (πλατεία) is the Greek word for town square. Most Greek and Cypriot cities have several town squares which are a point of reference in travelling and guiding. In traditional societies like villages and provincial communities, plateies are the central places for feasts, celebrations, events and meetings.
